hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We have enjoyed staying could not used swimming areas gym sauna. But staff are excellent and very polite Specially house keeping Harsha help us our 510 number thanks restaurant staffs are extremely friendly. Reception staff are quality. Zulekha Husein

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: *If you have business in the Financial District, location wise the hotel is very well situated, short walking distance from Wall Str, Water Str, etc.And now on to the letdowns:*Not everyone at the reception was very helpful or polite, some were quite dismissive*Rooms are very small. It's a very tiny space, hardly had any space between the wall/"wardrobe" and bed to open a standard sized suitcase.*Rooms are also not very well-kept. There was dust, spots on the walls, ripped wallpaper, etc.*Elevators are slow and it takes ages to go up or down. Some elevators weren't functioning properly during my visit.*Fresh linen was also a joke - bed sheets weren't changed.*Aircon or whatever that thing was in the hole in the wall was awfully loud and the air hits you directly wherever you are in the small room*Rooms aren't soundproof and you can easily hear what's going on in the corridor or in the rooms next youNot impressed with this hotel. I didn't even spend that much time in the room, I was there just to get some sleep. The overall feel of everything was old and tacky which was in huge contrast to the flashy images of the facade one encounters when first searching the hotel. I guess it's ok if you're visiting and just need a place to sleep but still not worth the money.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This was my third visit to New York but my first to the Four Points by Sheraton hotel. The staff were lovely and friendly, the hotel was clean. The rooms were spotless if a little on the small side - but hey who comes to NY to sit in their hotel rooms??! .... but THE BEDS!! OH MY ❤️ the joint most comfortable bed I’ve ever slept on (ranked joint first with a snuggly warm soft squishy delight in Switzerland). Sheraton - thank you for letting me rest my achey bones on one of your delightful mattresses.... I’m actually saving up to buy one ❤️

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The Four Points by Sheraton New York City Downtown is located just in walking distance to Wall Street. Overall impression ok, but a bit run down. Service warm and hearty, but a bit unprofessional. Fitness offered, no lounge. Would do again for the convenient location and ok rooms.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Not only did the hotel not respect the reservation, it did nothing to solve the problem. After an intercontinental flight arriving on the night of December 27th, the hotel claimed to be unaware of the reservation while acknowledging the existence of a message exchange confirming the reservation made.Result 5 people without hotel in new york at dawn on December 28.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night on New Year's Eve. It is a short walk to metro. It has a great restaurant (nice decor, bar, tables, etc) call Ketch right next to it. The restaurant is open for breakfast and open late. I stayed at a high floor, so I had a quiet night. The hotel is also close to a parking garage that gives you a discount if you stay at the hotel. Overall, it's a nice hotel (clean rooms and baths) with friendly staff, that is close to Metro (Fulton Street Station, most Subway lines). It is walking distance to Freedom Tower. I recommend it to everyone traveling to Downtown New York.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff at this hotel was exceptional. I stayed the week of Christmas and there was a mix up with my reservation. Lisa went above and beyond do help me solve the problem. She want out of her way to call me several times at the airport to straighten the matter out. I really appreciated it .

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Pre check in the manager helped us change our rate as it had lowered since booking - this did take multiple calls between us and different teams, central reservations need more training for sure. We had a speedy check in and were surprised at being able to check in early the day before new years eve. Staff were friendly throughout, we had a do not disturb sign on and the letter informing me about the service after 2pm is an excellent idea. The room was clean and had all we needed and the hotel is located in a quiet area but close to subways and the financial district, all we could have asked for. Only criticism would be that we asked for a blanket and were given a bed sheet which looked rather old and worn out, given the temperatures New York can get too I was expecting a thicker/fleece style blanket. I would stay again for sure.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed at Sheraton Downtown for a total of 5 nights and had a very pleasant experience. After some trouble at Check-In with charging the incorrect credit card, the issue was hastily rectified by the manager Hakim, who went to lengths to provide excellent customer service and made us feel at ease.The hotel room itself was modern and clean and the hotel was located a short walk from the 9/11 Memorial and Brooklyn Bridge. It is also serviced by a subway a few minutes walk away which was very convenient for getting about the city.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Clean hotel, attentive staff but too busy of a place and overbooked! Although a Bonvoy platinum member, we had to wait half an hour for our room. We arrived at 3:30 PM and didn’t get to our room until 4 PM. Did not get an upgrade as we should. Rooms were clean but too small. Too far for tourism. Twenty minutes with the subway to time square.  We visit New York City often with friends and family, but first time at this Sheraton location since the other ones were booked. Wouldn’t return at this location.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed 6 nights in this hotel ,rooms great ,small but average in NY, great location near to several subway stations , staff at reception very helpfull and friendly ,only downside is it probably isn't the easiest place to find if your not familiar with financial district other than that no complaints .

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Strategic location in downtown Manhattan, easy access to many locations in nyc and close to subway station. They offered affordable pricing during weekends which I booked for only $84 per night. Room is kinda small, but clean and enough for my short visit to nyc. Plenty of restaurants and convenient stores nearby, there is a larger 7-eleven store I have ever seen in the east coast. My only complaint was their breakfast, expensive and low quality.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Only giving 1 star because you can't give zero stars. I had a confirmed reservation with a valid credit card, per their central reservation system. Wanted to call them anyway because I was arriving late, but the published phone number didn't work. Had my office try to call them (it was a business trip), same result. They cancelled my room and their no other rooms to be had. Sacked out on their couch and went to my business meeting the next day exhausted. A real ordeal.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I chose this hotel primarily for its location, which was very convenient for me. The room was definitely on the small side, but it was adequate for my short stay. I found every member of the staff to be friendly and helpful. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I am only giving this hotel 1 star because I can't leave a comment otherwise. I made a reservation months ago because I needed to be in NY for work. I got an E-mail saying they couldn't guarantee my reservation because there was an issue with the credit card I provided when I made the reservation. The issue was that the credit I had used to book the reservation was closed due to unrecognized activity and I was issued a new one. I called this hotel directly to give them the new credit card info asap. I had to call 6 times to finally be connected to someone in billing. The woman I spoke to said they couldn't take the info over the phone to simply give them the new card info when I check in. Next day I arrived in NY, went to check it only to be told that my reservation was cancelled after I was guaranteed it wouldn't be. Then the manager has the audacity to tell me if I can't remember who I spoke to then she can't help me. Although I showed her how many times I called. I didn't realize I would have to take a name due to possible incompetence. They sent me an Email that they were cancelling my reservation at 4:20pm when I was literally waking over to the hotel from my job a few blocks away. To say that I am frustrated and angry is an understatement. Their blant disregard for their customers is ridiculous. But to top it off I know what they actually did was over book and since I didn't check in earlier I was left with no room. I hope Corporate reads this and do something.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel was close to where we needed to be, everything is in walking distance. Room was a nice size and comfortable. The only thing missing was a comfortable chair on which you had the option of not sitting on the bed. Thank you Kai for the prompt return of my jacket.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: As a constant Road Warrior and Ambassador Elite Marriott member, having superb staff-service takes the sting out of being on the road so much (220 nights away so far this year). From my first moments at the front desk with DJ, I knew that I was in good hands. Peter then took a turn at supporting me in just the right ways. Elisa Lopez continued the front desk uplift on ensuing days. And Manager Katherine was a major delight in figuring out how to approach a particular situation.The location is also convenient to all lower Manhattan business and tourist destinations including easy access to the Subway.What an AMAZING team!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel/Laundry service lost a full suitcase of clothes and did almost nothing to offer actual cash compensation for the 16 items of clothing lost. We missed meetings, were late to the office, lost out on a client engagement event, etc.DO NOT stay at this hotel. There are so many other options in FiDi and you will be happier else where. I recommend Club Quarters or AKA.I could not believe the response. They would only offer compensation if we had receipts for every single item of clothing they lost.... WHAT?! They did not even refund the cost of laundry that they charged.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Arrived the hotel early today and asked for an early checkin, if available. The lady and the guys at the checkin counter were both really rude and with no smile the whole time. Also, they did not accommodate anything for the request even though I got the elite status. The only thing I can hear is that the check in time is 3. What a terrible hotel to be managed by Marriott. I have been staying in so many Marriott chain hotels before but this is the worst one I ever stayed so far. Also, there are constant construction outside of the hotel. As such, i will not recommend anyone to stay here due to the pool quality of services.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: People at the front desk were nice and service was very good.Rooms are tiny and NO Netflix.Get off the subway many times and unable to locate this hotel.It's on a small street impossible to find. Because of this problem-- We Do NOT recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I was in NY this week on two occasions, one planned and the other unplanned. I stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton downtown both times. The first time I paid full fare and was placed on an upper floor at the back of the hotel. It was quiet and comfortable. The rooms were to my surprise clean and updated. My room had two double beds. The bathroom was spacious with good counter space.The second time I ended up staying at the last minute because my meeting ran long and I booked through an online hotel app that provides low rates for unsold rooms to fill hotels. This time I was not so comfortable. I was put on the 4th floor at the front of the hotel in an exceptionally tiny corner room with a very small bathroom. One double bed barely fit and it was difficult to get into one side of the bed because it was almost up against the wall. It was noisy and cold and because it was so small every time I put the heat on, even at 72, the room got too hot. So I was up and down all night changing the thermostat. I could hear everything on the street.Bottom line is that I would stay here again but only on an upper floor with a decent sized room.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My wife and I live in Vermont. We spent the weekend in New York City due to a family emergency. Whenever we go to the city we are totally out of our comfort zone.Our stay at the Four Points By Sheridan was very pleasant and took our big city fears away! The staff went way out of their way several times to point out where to catch the subway, the parking process, and places to eat etc. The most impressive support was provided by Kei Lin who is the is the head of housekeeping.We had decided to beat the traffic and leave the city early Sunday morning. In our haste my wife left her calendar book and I pad in the room.We called and left a message for housekeeping when we got home. Kei called us the next day and had secured my wife's things and arranged to have them sent to Vermont. I offered to send a reward for the items. Kei graciously declined and said that this was part of their responsibilities and a reward was not necessary.Our experience at Four Points so positive we will definitely book with them on our next trip.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was adequate, however when we ordered a continental breakfast from room service, the bedside menu listed it at $15. When we checked out (prepaid on my credit card) they had charged us double that. I was told I would need to call this in to their Accounting dept. I tried multiple times to reach someone there to resolve this, and was always asked to leave a message. The front desk clerk promised to relay the message and I never received a call back to resolve this charge. I would never stay there again.

NY-Greenport
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This was our first visit to USA, I don't know is it possible that the European standard is just higher but frankly - I've been in 3 stars hotels in Europe that were more impressive than this.The lobby is small and unimpressive, there was not even a bar there in case you feel like having a drink in the evening - but that's no big deal. The room just looked... poor. One can argue about design taste (but really there wasn't much design here), but everything in that room seemed old, the carpet, some of the closet doors didn't open/close smoothly, the shower had an ugly curtain.I mean everything was clean but honestly when I pay that much money and it's 4 stars, I expect more. Oh and I'm not sure is this another American thing, but what's the deal with water pressure in the shower? I can't control it separately from the heat, as much as the water is hotter, the pressure is higher, but if I don't want to get burns the pressure is totally lame. That was just ridiculous.I will finish with the good things though. The service was very nice and helpful. The location is convenient, walking distance to Ground Zero, Brooklyn Bridge, Battery Park and China Town. The area isn't very attractive and there was a lot of construction work going on on the street but overall it was a nice spot to travel from.I suppose they just need an overall makeover. Or charge much less so one can lower the expectations.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel has a great location in downtown and very walkable which is why we chose to stay here for our short one night stay. Unfortunately, they are expanding this building to include additional Marriott properties which has produced a lot of construction, noise and great difficulty in accessing the property. In addition there was no hot water in our room upon departure. Maintenance tried to resolve but was not successful in doing so before we had to depart causing an uncomfortable start to our day. The hotel management was made aware but has not yet reached out to us to extend their apologies, including with the traditional email survey guests are supposed to receive upon departure. As an elite member, what this room really an upgrade?This certainly isn't the worst place to stay while in New York, but based on my experience I'd likely pick another option...there are so many others to choose from!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I had been looking for a reasonably priced hotel that would be a good home-base to visit lower Manhattan, and head over to Brooklyn in the a.m. for the start of the Tunnel 2 Towers run/walk. Although in a somewhat difficult-to-find location -- definitely let a taxi driver know this is at the corner of Platt and Gold Streets -- it was simple and clean, within walking distance of the 9/11 Memorial and Museum. You're a short taxi ride away from Soho, Little Italy and Nolita, just to name a few neighborhoods. A cab ride, or car hire, to and from LaGuardia Airport is roughly $60. The rooms are tiny, and the hotel area seems a little desolate on the weekends, but it all depends on what your plans are when visiting. Peter, the concierge, was wonderful and, in addition to giving great suggestions, was fun to talk with. All in all, a good stay in New York.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Never had a chance to stay here, but the king suite specifically says king suite with sofa bed when you click on the pic. Called front desk and they said suite has no sofa bed. I wasn't looking at the pic when i called, So when I went back to see it, yeah it said 4 people with sofa bed....thought I was losing my mind, Then I read the other reviews and someone else said the same thing..This was a total waist of my time. They need to correct the wrong information on site......It takes al long time to plan vacation time for two different families so info about hotel rooms should be correct and current.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is well situated, close to ground zero and easily accessible to Fulton station. Our best investment was the metro card at 33 dollars. We used it to the max! Hotel had great friendly helpful staff.we stayed on 7th floor. Only bug bear was the lack of view to the outside, so we never knew what the weather was like until we stepped outside. LolKing size comfy bed. Wardrobe was too short for my dresses. But the room was well equipped.Hotel staff quick to respond and fix problems. Our minor one was that the safe battery needed replacing It was attended to immediately. No complaints here. A great place to stay. And happy hour in ketch is from 4 till 7. And if it rains all you have to do is go next door for some great food.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The Four Points Sheraton New York Downtown was a very clean and modern, highrise hotel in the middle of downtown.I thought the location was great. An easy walk to the World Trade Center & 9/11 Memorial and Museum, the NY Stock Exchange and Battery Park. Lots of food choices in the area, and close to the subway station.The rooms were small, like many in Manhattan, but it was very clean and modern. It had a safe, but no refrigerator, though they did provide a bottle of water each day. It was a nice respite to the hustle and bustle outside.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My boyfriend and I was checked in by DJ. She was able to get us checked in early which was amazing due to the fact that we have been traveling all day. The room was not ready when we arrived but she gave us a call back as soon as a room was ready and we definitely did not wait long. When she checked by boyfriend's ID and realized it was his birthday she also upgraded our room.! the staff overall was amazing when it came to pointing us in the direction we needed to go, printing out boarding passes and arranging a private car service. Thank You all for making our stay a good one ! will be back soon

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We got recently married in New York City and choose Four Points Downtown as our Hotel for the 6 days stay.Also our family stayed in the same hotel. The Staff was super helpful and everything was possible to organize including upgrades to a Suit and having personal gifts in the other rooms. A big thank for the frontdesk for their help!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Be careful when choosing complimentary breakfast: you will get a heavily reduced breakfast menu than the person sitting next to you with a portion size that is embarrassing.After asking regarding the different treatment between loyal member and "normal guest" the hotel management just referred to the restaurant as being managed by a third party and therefore not under their control.Additionally, their internal communication does not seem to work. Promises regarding "we will speak with the management" where several times not hold.After staying over 100 nights this year in Marriott hotels this was the worst experience I ever had for a loyal member and therefore can not recomnend the hotel.Or how would you feel if all persons around you get an amazing looking breakfast and you get a spare item?

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We got a really cheap price for a Thursday night stay in the city. Updated, clean but small rooms. Nice fitness center. Coffee in the lobby in the morning. Ate at a cute little diner around the corner because no breakfast was available in the hotel. Would stay here again if the price was right. Guys at the front desk were nice.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My stay in Four Point New York Downtown – August 2019. New York hotels are difficult so typically I don’t expect much. However, this time was especially unpleasant thanks to Marriot Bonvoy incompetence. I had offer to upgrade my stay to Suite Night which I applied for. Upgrade was confirmed by Marriot Bonvoy via email. However when I got there it turned out to be not true and I was given confusing-contradicting answers from the front desk. When I asked for manager she refused to see me or speak with me. Then I contacted Bonvoy help and finally after long time of explaining/waiting I got this short cold answer “System Error”. Unpleasant, demeaning, and incompetent.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: the hotel was located great for my quick visit to NYC, the staff was really friendly and nice and even approved my early check-in (your24 service) room was small but had all I needed, I would have liked the carpet and corners to clean a bit more, it was full of dust but this may have been a one-off as I arrived early and they did not have a chance to clean it.

New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We arrived only to find out that there was an issue with our room that we booked months ago. The staff then proceeded to place us in 2 king size rooms. We are a family of 4 with two small kids, so this was not ideal. The rooms were really small - thankfully we were only staying one night. The location is quiet and close to the waterfront. Overall, we were not impressed.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Nothing good or bad to say just what you would expect.I will add that my GPS had a horrible time locating the hotel which is in a very conjested area. Then my Uber driver had the same problem finding the address and started driving some where else until I corrected him.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Have stayed here four times in the last two months on business, usually for 2 nights at a time. Many high points. First and foremost, great front desk staff. VERY welcoming, they really terry to personally engage with their guest, which in my experience in staying at hotels at this level, is very rare. I loved it. They went well beyond what they needed to on every visit I made in a way that was memorable for me. Second, the place is clean, well located and never had an issue with anything in the room working as expected. Big plus. The location is helped a lot in my opinion by a restaurant on premises (Ketch Brewhouse) which is handy even if the menu is just ok. Nice to have it. There are also many restaurants within a block and tables and a small “park” with tables just outside the front door. I enjoy staying here on my frequent business trips for all these reasons. The only reason this is not 5 stars is because there are a few buildings immediately adjacent that are vacant and dilapidated and there were vermin running around at night. Not uncommon in New York and not the hotel’s fault, for sure, but really unattractive. I will be back, in hopes that the neighboring properties get fixed up soon!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Great room. Spacious, comfortable and very clean. Good location close to metro. Rooms quiet. Well air conditioned. Staff were helpful. We had a great price but apparently rates can vary quite a bit. Loved our stay here.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We were very disappointed when we arrived to find a building site all around the hotel. Our 'spacious' room (description by reception) was no bigger than our stateroom on the cruise ship we had just left, looked out over a rooftop strewn with rubble. Having said that, the staff were very good and helpful but we would think twice before using this hotel again. It's best part was the Ketch Restaurant.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice hotel tucked down a side street, very clean and tidy with really helpful staff. The rooms are a decent size and are in very good condition with coffee in the room. In a decent location 5 to 10 minute walk to 9/11 and one world trade centre, on wall street door step and 10 mins from Brooklyn Bridge. Subway only 5 minutes walk easy to get to uptown with Times Sq 4 stops. Decent deli around corner for breakfast and other convenience stores nearby. Would stay here again

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is located walking distance to brooklyn bridge, wall street, 911 memorial and the ferry to statue of liberty so it suited us as tourists. It was also only a 5 minute walk to the subway station, which we used to get to times square and central park. The area where this hotel is located is queit at night yet we struggled to sleep each night with the loud generator for the aircon that was in the wall of our room. Also the receptionist tried to charge us a second time for the room even though we had prepaid, and was not apologetic when she realised we had already paid.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Had occasion to use this Hotel in early May 2019 for a business trip to New York. It was chosen by the hosts, and well worth the choice. Check staff were friendly and helpful, rooms of good proportions and kept spotlessly clean. Bathroom well stocked with spacious shower unit with eco friendly soap dispensers. Meeting rooms were convenient and kept in good order. Bar and adjacent restaurant provided great service and varied drinks and food. Hotel is conveniently located in the financial district and short walks to major sites and landmarks. Location in side street possibly not the best for any taxi drivers unsure of landscape.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is close to multiple subway entries and within walking distance from wall street and the 9/11 memorial, also within walking distance from Battery Park (ferries to visit Liberty Island and Ellis Island).The hotel itself is small, it does have a fitness center with multiple equipment but does get crowded in the morning. Our room was a standard king size bed room and oh my it was super small! barely enough room for the bed and the tv, bathroom was of nice size.I would have loved to have more hanging space in the walls with the room being that small but I guess that is how it is in NYC. Room was also quite noisy at night (we could hear the elevators working and some pipes singing their song all night )We paid ~200usd per night.We chose this hotel because of the pictures of the rooftop bar only to find out that is not really open to the public, only used for private events (such a disappointment).All the staff was really friendly and accommodating.Coming from Texas were everything is extra big, this was a show to us but I guess that is life in the big apple. I do recommend it though.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for a week & we found the location really convenient to reach out to any subway station & it’s also busy area with lots of offices. Therefore, You can find good eateries near this hotel or take a metro to get to the Times Square. Service is great & staff was also good. No breakfast options available but you can find some good cafe’s within 5 minutes walk.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: One of the most convenient in NYC and very clean.Staff are helpful, location is great near to battery park where you go to statue of liberty.Price is reasonable compared to location. Near to many subway stations.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed 4 nights in May, Friday- Tuesday. We flew into LaGuardia airport it was a 25 minute ride with Uber for about $55. This hotel is in walking distance to Wall Street, the 9-11 Memorial and Battery Park. The subway is close by and a short ride uptown. Pearls diner around the corner for an inexpensive breakfast before sightseeing. Hotel staff friendly and ready to navigate you to your next destination. The hotel will Schedule a 60 dollar taxi ride back to LaGuardia.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Just spent there 3 nights with both my kids 12 & 10 years old. Receptionist was very kind to give us a room at 11 am, 4 hours before check in time.Room was clean, quiet and had everything we needed . A nice supermarket a block away and metro station less than three blocks away.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: ridiculous, arrived in a Thursday night at midnight, one clerk at desk, taking an hour to check in. guess they can't afford staff. outrageous. I can't believe this, I am still waiting. I mean, really? the lobby was shabby. the location insalubrious. methinks perhaps this is what hell is like, standing in line forever to check in at an extremely mediocre hotel. I can assure this is the last time I will ever consider staying in such a beastly accommodation. the nerve of these people.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Wonderful location away from the Times Square chaos. Lovely, small park outside the registration. Plenty of restaurants to choose from, well within walking distance. The staff was courteous, helpful and friendly. In particular was Peter from the security department. He always had some great advise and was very welcoming. Our room was clean, quiet and well appointed. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The room that I received was VERY small. Had this not been the only hotel in Manhattan that during the week of our stay offered two double beds, I would have moved into a completely different hotel. The room was dusty, and there were very few amenities. No continental breakfast.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: After 30 minutes of being within. Block of the hotel, we finally find it. We walk in and the man begins the desk attacked me saying "You can't park your van here!" I knew parking garages existed so I ignored it. I went to see if I could check in (at 2:15), as some hotels are early. I was told no.  Looking around the lobby and "courtyard" I realized that the hotel was not as pictured or advertised. It was nasty. I have no spleen, so i need a clean hotel. I've seen horrible hotels have nice lobby's so you think their rooms are as such. This was not the case. It was gross and disorganized.  I then asked to see a room so we could decide if this was a place we'd feel comfortable with. I was told I could not. They told me I could check in a look at the room then. I said what if it's not what I expect. He said you can check out and lose your first nights charges. I repeated said "It may be what I expect and I'll be fine to stay here, but I need to see it." Hakim said no. I called Mariott. They were shocked that I couldn't see a room. Thry said that's standard procedure to let a customer see a room. Hakim said no, that they have A 3RD PARTY OWNER AND MARIOTT HAS NO SAY IN HOW THEY RUN THEIR HOTEL! That's very important to know! I asked to speak to the manager Arthur Cheung. Hakim grabbed a business card and slammed it down on the counter as if to say, this will do nothing and won't affect me. He then said, stay her or don't, I don't care.  I knew he didn't care because I found out 2 days before when I attempted to add another days stay there, that they were over booked. The woman called it negative 2 rooms. I asked what happens when I arrive and you are over booked? She said, well, almost always someone cancels. Almost always? So Halim was right. He didn't care, because he needed my 2 rooms!!  I called the manger that day, I called every other day since, and Arthur has yet to return my call. The staff could care less about you or your stay. They wasted 3 hours of our first day in NY with my family and elderly parents, by forcing us to find another hotel. We found an ACTUAL Marriott and it was clean in the lobby, the restrooms, the restaurant, the elevators, the hallways and the rooms.  Dont waste your time trying to stay here if you are use to a Marriott. It isnt a Marriott and shouldn't be able to fool people that it is because of a merger. Dont waste 3 hours of your day, find somewhere else. The staff nor manger could care less.  OHHHHH, and they still have yet to refund our money a week and a half later. Absolutely horrible experience.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Be careful if you book here online. They took and confirmed my reservation, then, day of, cancelled it, told me they had no availability, and offered no apology. My wife was pregnant, so this was super harsh.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We were happy to be staying so close the metro lines at Fulton Street and the World Trade Center. We appreciated the reasonable “Senior Rate” for a hotel in Manhattan, and enjoyed how quiet the Financial District is during the weekend.The cozy sized room with two double beds was clean with comfortable beds and bedding. One problem: despite any temp we set on the thermostat, the room got VERY warm, but I was grateful to discover that the window opened a few inches. The open window added a lot of city noises into the room, but the lower evening temps made the room comfortable for sleep.Thank goodness that the bathroom had bright lighting so we could see to do our hair and makeup. However, the bedroom was as dark as a nightclub. Impossible to read a book, glad I had a kindle.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights while vacationing in NYC with the wife. We reserved this place on booking.com and chose it due to its location and relatively competitive price for a Manhattan hotel. We ubered it from EWR (Newark airport) on a Thursday afternoon and it took about 50 minutes.Pros:Great location - about a 5-10 minute walk to Fulton St. Station (subway). Italian restaurant/sports bar located on first floor serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. Several cafes and restaurants nearby along with a small grocery store (55 Fulton Market). For coffee/bagels, go to Blue Spoon Co. For a cafe, go to La Parisienne. This hotel was also an easy 15 minute walk to the 9/11 museum/memorial, and a 20 minute walk to Battery Park where the ferry for the Statue of Liberty departs. It is also 15 minute walk to Chinatown and a short walk to the entrance of Brooklyn bridge (it will be about a 45-60 minute walk to DUMBO Brooklyn).Comfortable room - everything felt and looked new. WIFI was sometimes slow but reliable for the most part. TV had a handful of HBO channels, 2 Showtime channels, and some international channels including Japan NHK.Friendly Service - all staff greet you with a smile. They will help with any tourist type questions.Cons:Small Room - a standard king room can feel a little crammed for 2 peopleNo mini fridge in roomHousekeeping staff provide 1 free water bottle per day - it would be nice to get 2 bottles.Elevators are fast but can get crowded fairly quickly during busy hoursI would stay here again when visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The perfect quiet hotel in busy downtown NYC. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was spotless clean and the bed was so comfortable. Would highly recommend for a stay...if you want to relax and enjoy a good nights sleep after a busy day out and about.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Very friendly staff who cannot do enough to make you feel welcome. The hotel and my room spotlessly clean. Comfortable beds and all facilities in the room . Would definitely recommend and stay here again. It is also well situated .

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Comfortable long stay room (for a week). Quieter than other hotels I have stayed at in NYC. Slightly outdated decor in room, but not bad. No refrigerator in room, but I mostly ate at neighborhood restaurants. Slow, but functional, wifi. Try the Maine lobster roll in the restaurant on a Sunday night.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Arrived late on an evening and check in was extremely efficient, with friendly helpful staff. We asked several times for local information and always the staff were helpful and knowledgeable . Location was fabulous , near to downtown bars , restaurants and tourist attractions. Room was spacious, modern and comfortable, bed was fab, mid to firm.Room was well equipped, safe, large tv, coffee machine, iron and toiletries in bathroom were great quality. Loved the free takeaway coffee in reception in a morning, ketch bar attached had happy hour every night 4pm - 7pm with great selection of drinks and snacks included, again staff were very friendly ( everyone in NYC loved our accent and wanted to talk ).Had a full last day and again reception staff were incredibly attentive keeping our luggage until late evening . .Can't wait to come back to NYC and will definetly stay here again .

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location, relatively new room and free of traffic noise, especially on weekends. Interior walls and guestroom doors are horrible to insulate corridors and neighbor noise. Some rooms are laid out with 3 guestroom doors so adjacent to each other, that everytime guestroom door is opened/shut - the bed headboard shakes. I happened to stay in a room where there's a group of friends who stay in multiple rooms on the same floor - and they keep shutting/closing doors and chatted loudly in the corridors. You can even hear your neighbor's TV playing as you're trying to rest. No peaceful sleep here. Also, wifi speed is pitiful.Don't expect any kind of upgrade - as an Ambassador Elite, I got no room upgrade (10th floor out of 20 something). Breakfast is super modest, so don't get too excited with the vouchers.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We absolutely looved this hotel! Everything was perfect! We will definitely go back when in the area. It is close to many food spots and transportation.The One World trade Center is just up the road. Shopping is also easy with lots of stores.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Sister lives next door to hotel and we usually house family members there during holidays and random weekend visits.This is the last time! TERRIBLE SERVICE AND MISREPRESENTATION ON WEBSITE/APP.I have Ambassador Elite status (New Marriott Bonvoy Branding/highest tier)Used a Suite Night Award to get the Suite with ‘Sofa Bed’. Sofa Bed non-existent. 2 adults and a teenager were staying there. That was the whole point.Service was terrible and they didn’t answer phone.Had to call many times. Not worth the hassle. Too many options in New York.To the Manager on duty, Dominque... thanks for going home before making sure everything was sorted out for room 2807. I guess you weren’t cleaning rooms all night. We spoke first around 11:15pm on 3/9 and I called again at 11:40pm, spoke to front desk and they said you went home for the night because your shift was over.Not being full service, doesn’t mean NO SERVICE!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I do not recommend this hotel whatsoever. The representatives are not tentative. Not only were the issues during check in (system issue - which required a manager for assistance), there was water issues the following day. I called the front desk at 6AM and Brandon mentioned that someone would be right up. 6:30AM, still no one so I called again and he said “oh right, I’ll send someone up right away.” His exact words was clear to me that he forgot to address my concerns which resulted to a delay! 6:50AM, a maintainece worker finally came up and said “a lot of people are experiencing this and we’re going room to room to work on this. At least you have a little bit of pressure right now.” It upsets me because you don’t start on the lower level first; you ought to assist those that dial in first! The people that haven’t called probably don’t need to water at 6AM as some of us do - should be first come first serve! To mention, there was no water pressure - not a single drip. I waited until 7AM and the water is completely yellow! I called again to inquiry and Brandon did not have an ETA. In a result of this, I was late to a very important business meeting. Nonetheless, I will never return to this hotel!!!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: When I have work dinners/events close to my office in FiDi I typically stay at this Four Points around 5-6 times a year. The hotel is conveniently located to all major sites and offices in the Financial District as it's located right in the middle, not on either side by the water as some offices are which makes it difficult to get around. Right next to the hotel is an amazing bar called Stout with craft beer/decent food, across the street is Felice which is one of the best italian spots in FiDi and you're only a few min walk from the subway at Fulton or Wall st. Rooms are clean and well appointed and the bar at the bottom of the hotel has a nice rooftop. Highly recommend staying here for work or personal as you can get a decent rate if you book ahead. The GM is also one of the most hospitable GM's I've ever dealt with, thank you Arthur!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Thank you! Our family enjoyed our stay at this FP . Our room was larger than expected. Service was excellent. Bed was so comfortable! We appreciated the location. Close to trains, memorials, restaurants...

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: They refuse to open or give me a new key for my room after my key was locked inside the car n I want find the car keys and they call 911 without any reason just because I was asked them for a new key and I got mad because the situation

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here from the 12th till 17th January. We arrived pretty late in the evening, had a nice easy check in, was a breeze getting in the room. We were on the 11th floor, had a nice view out on the front plaza of the hotel. The room was huge and warm. The bed was comfortable, just could have been a bit bigger in my opinion but it wasn’t the worst. The tv was huge, good selection of tv channels for those lazy evenings in the room or lazy mornings. The bathroom was nice, modern. Shower was ok, not the most powerful but very hot. All in all, I would stay here again!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Very affordable, sleek and modern hotel and super close to the Seaport. We walked to that area in 7 minutes and saved Uber fees. My son and I were able to enjoy a cruise to the Statue of Liberty before it started to rain that evening. There's also a really wonderful Italian restaurant on the corner adjacent to the hotel. Check in and check out was simple with no hassle. I would stay again with no hesitation.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My family and I stayed at FPBS New York Downtown for eight nights in December. I booked it through a third party booking app. I produced my credit card and was charged for the first night upon check in, which was normal.When I was checking out, I was charged the full amount of the invoice, so I mentioned that the first night had already been paid for and I should have just paid for the balance of the invoice. The Guest Service Officer in charge at the time assured me that the first night would be reversed, and that this was a normal procedure at FPBS.Since then, I have been waiting for the reversal and nothing has happened. I am still overcharged by $200+ and trying to contact the accountant to resolve this matter has proven to be mission impossible.I have called FPBS numerous times to try to speak to the accountant and every time I called Ms. Cynthia Jing, “the only person in the whole company who has the authority to reverse transactions”, seemed to be having her day off. Ms. Katherine Rosario, a Guest Service Officer whom I spoke to before Christmas, had “personally” asked me to give her a chance to bring this up to Cynthia and “personally” given me her word to resolve this issue. I even sent Ms. Rosario and Ms. Jing both a direct e-mail as per Ms. Rosario’s request, and neither has ever replied to my e-mail.The last time I spoke to Ms. Rosario was this morning (and of course Ms. Jing was absent again today), and I asked her to just let me talk to anyone who might be able to help me. I even said, “Cynthia can’t be the only one in the whole company authorized to reverse a transaction. If she dies today, no one else can do anything with accounts?” She then put me on hold for almost 15 minutes only to get to an answering machine. I hung up.This whole overcharging drama has left me no other choice but to write this rather unfortunate event here. I have been holding it off for more than a month, giving FPBS a chance to do what they said they would. The most disappointing part is not the overcharge itself. It’s the way the staff deals with the issue, not replying to my e-mails, giving empty promises, and not having the courtesy to actually solve the problem.It’s too bad, because the actual stay at FPBS was quite lovely, despite minor issues with the housekeeping. If anyone at FPBS still has the decency to return my calls and e-mails, fine. If not, then let my story be known to everyone who is considering to stay at FPBS New York Downtown. Just be aware that their smiling faces, friendly tones, and reassuring promises do not always translate to real action.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Took my wife to New York for her Birthday. The stay at the hotel was good.Problems arose after we left. Having received our final bill, which showed no additional costs, as expected, as we paid cash in the bar and restaurant, I received a notification on my credit card account that I had been billed an extra amount close to $500. I contacted the customer services immediately to ask what this amount was for, I was promised that the hotel management would contact me to explain what the bill was for. Three further emails and no one has still contacted me either by phone or email (both provided). I have now had to request my credit card company and British Airways to intervene who the holiday was booked with.Very disappointed, ruined the whole trip for my wife, and have still not had the funds returned that have been falsely taken. Avoid this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I enjoyed my stay in this hotel. First of all it is located not far from the station, yet the neighborhood was not too crowded. Even though I did not take the breakfast, there were plenty of deli and breakfast options nearby. The room was okay, comfortable, the amenities were provided, minibar and safe box also available. The bathroom size was okay, not too small, the water flow was very good, and the temperature (hot water) was convenient.The medium size lobby area that was breathtaking, with a business center in it was completed with 3 elevators that runs 24 hours, and a welcome drink (coffee station) in the lobby from morning till afternoon.Revolving door and the manual doors were available, and the staffs were helpful and knowledgeable. I suggest to take the corner room that is bigger.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Really enjoyed our stay. Front desk staff really care and look after you. Hakim is really tops! We stayed a total of four nights this time. Really close to Wall Street and Freedom Tower. Many restaurants near by. Will return down the road.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: If you love NYC, but love sleeping more, I suggest this hotel. Away from the busy streets and traffic, Financial District is quiet during the evenings and weekends. The hotel is no further than 2 or 3 minutes walk from different subway lines, which means that you can get easily to any attraction in New York.The hotel is quite new, so everything is in top shape. Great bed and curtains that hide outside light completely. We had the smaller room, so we did not have much space, but you don't go to Manhattan to stay in the room all day.Very good service from staff. Our only drawback was that an alarm on the phone woke us at midnight (an alarm, not a phone call) - but we mentioned it to the desk and it didn't repeat.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed in three double bedded rooms for 4 nights from Dec 27-31, 2018 at this hotel. Kelvin and his dynamic team members took great care of us in providing quality accommodation, customized vegetarian food in the restaurant, water bottles and a wheel chair making our stay very comfortable.. On the way back to the airport, we forgot out suitcase and the hotel was kind enough to arrange a transport to carry the same to JFK airport in a record time period of 1 hour and hence , we were able to get the luggage with us in the aircraft,We will strongly recommend this hotel to visitors who come for sightseeing as this is comfortably located in closer proximity to many milestone with excellent connectivity.We give 10/10 rating to this hotel and Kelvin is a fantastic person , who meets and exceeds the expectations.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed 3 nights and room not cleaned even once! We stayed at this hotel in two rooms mainly due to the location and to spend time with family. The first morning, I noticed hair on the shower tile wall and felt as if the shower had not been cleaned. I spoke to the front desk person about this to make sure it would be addressed. We got back late and found they never cleaned the room. Same thing happened the next day with us returning at midnight to find the room had not been cleaned again. In our second room, the do not disturb sign was up one morning, but not on the second morning. This room was not cleaned either. After all of this they offered us 5000 points. We would have gotten 2000 points with the Green sign anyway. This just was not our choice. Extremely disappointed in this hotel! The only good thing was the location.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We had two rooms booked and were assigned a corner room and a standard room on the 19th floor. The standard room was small, which was to be expected of a NYC hotel, and the corner room was nice - we hang out here after a long day of walking since it was the bigger one out of the two. Surprisingly, the bathroom is decently sized and I liked that both rooms had stand up showers which I prefer over bath tubs. Rooms were still new, carpets were clean - a really nice Four Points. The hotel is located 3-5 minutes away from Fulton station - we followed signs for William Street exit. We walked to Battery Park, World Trade Center, and Brooklyn Bridge from the hotel and are closely located to the hotel. We drove in to NYC and had to park our car in the garage behind the hotel (put 201 Pearl St on your GPS) and paid $32 per night with hotel validation. On our first night, the fire alarm went off for about 10 minutes and the Fire Department came as quick as can be. We stayed in the room and waited for announcements and were informed it was a false alarm, luckily - we were located on the 19th floor and can’t imagine having to go down 19 flights of stairs. The alarm did not bother us at all as we had just gone to bed and understand that it is for our own safety. Overall, our stay was great and will stay here again the next time we visit NYC. Reading previous reviews though, I am so inclined to give my two cents to the person who rated the hotel two stars saying she was “infuriated.” First of all, based on my understanding, Marriott Friends and Family rate is for pleasure stays ONLY and NOT for business. You should be grateful for the priviledge you have of a discounted stay. If your stay did no go as planned, think of the discount you are getting compared to the regular rate you were to pay if you did not have a family or a friend working for the Marriott chain of hotels. So with this discount, you have already been compensated for your troubles. Consider acting accordingly as well, this may cause your friend or family’s job, they are indeed responsible for you. Second, you opted to stay in NEW YORK CITY - if you are trying to do business work, DO NOT stay in the city! Construction is everywhere and the hotel does not have control over any construction in the surrounding area. Third, your comments say you discussed “options of extending your stay” - I don’t think this meant “comping your stay.” So don’t blame the agent for not comping your stay, I am sure you did not deserve getting a comp stay. Four, why stay at a hotel if you know you don’t have the money to pay for the stay and expect the hotel to comp your stay? How is this the hotel’s problem? Having to borrow money to pay for your stay does not justify your low rating for this hotel. Lastly, the fire alarm does not also justify for any compensation - it is there for our own safety. If it did not go off in case of a real fire, I guess you just have to be thankful since you did not want to be bothered anyway on your “business trip.” So my advice, stop complaining and think twice when you are on a discounted rate - Employee discounted rates to be exact. Consider the amount you are saving over the troubles you may be experiencing. Perhaps staying outside the city may be the best option the next time you go on a business trip in New York. That is all.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Booked this hotel for a 3 night birthday trip, and I’m so glad we did! About a 45 min uber ride ($50-60) from EWR during peak times. Front desk staff were very kind and were able to hold our baggage at the desk. The room was standard size and bed was comfortable with nice TV and coffee in room and in lobby. This hotel is in a great location in the financial district on a quiet block. Fulton street station is an easy ~3-5min walk with multiple lines available to easily navigate to nearly anywhere in the city including directly to 34th Street/Penn Station, time square, and Grand Central. The WTC, Wall Street, and Courtland stations are also a short walk away. There are also several attractions within walking distance. Overall, a great experience and we would stay again!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I came to New York and stayed here on business. Most of my business calls I planned to do in my room and take my in person meetings nearby. Upon check in there was no notification (at least to me) that there would be loud construction in our hotel from 9AM - 4PM the entire week. Twice the construction was so bad I physically had to walk down to a co working space and pay for a soundproof room. When I made it aware to the staff downstairs Bria was nice enough to offer me two drink vouchers, but I do not drink. We then discussed another option in extending my stay. She told me she would gladly extend my stay but could not adjust my daily rate since I was on an explore family and friends rate. What she failed to throughly explain was that she did not plan to comp the additional day. When it came time to check out she gave me a different total than what I was expecting. When I looked her in her eyes and said “the additional day was supposed to be comped” she didn’t take accountability. She even called her manager and there was nothing done. I left having to borrow money to close out the rest of my reservation. Not to mention there was a accidental fire alarm at 1AM that went on into afternoon on my last night, and no one was compensated for the trouble. My day rate was low but this is besides the point. Bria, the front desk clerk did not take accountability for what we agreed upon the night before. I would have never agreed to pay MORE to stay in a hotel with issues. The lack of understanding and accountability management and the front desk clerks took was unbelievable. They based what the $ amount of my day rate was on their final decision instead of just doing the right thing. I had a great conversation and received helpful vegan suggestions from one of the managers Katherine. However, I’m extremely upset with the way Bria looked me right in the eyes and claimed to have not agreed to comp my extended evening. Again, Why would I agree to pay for an additional night when I had to PAY to leave my own hotel more than once just to take my business calls due to construction, false alarms and other disturbances. Staff is nice but I was so infuriated after that check out experience I had to write this review. Another manager (Domonique) was called by Bria and informed of the situation. Instead of truly investigating the situation, she said my family member who offered me the opportunity to use the explore rate would be responsible. (Which was equally infuriating) Not only are my husband and myself loyal Marriott members. My family member who offered this explore rate has been with the company for almost 20 years. We are also Hilton time share owners and had the opportunity to stay in a Hilton property nearby booked on solid points and chose your property instead. Let me reiterate, We CHOSE to you give you guys our business. My colleague who stayed with me will be writing a review as well.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was nice and the desk staff were professional. The only issue was the late check-in at 3pm. Although many checked out the rooms were not ready for checking until late in afternoon. Bags were stored but it would have been nice to be able to unwind after travelling in your room. Rooms were clean and well stocked. Lobby was clean and well designed.
