hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This ia a nice hotel... The hotel staff were friendly and informative. Nice room size and comfortable bed. Great location, in walking distance to 911 Memorial, public transportation, and great food choices.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Hi, we spent some days at the Four Points Sheraton New York and had a very good stay. The best thing happened to us was Amanda (front desk manager) who kept our luggage for 10 days safe, while we travelled to the west coast. As one guest said before AMANDA you rock. Thx a lot and you made our stay and your name as you can see 3 month later, unforgettable. Lisa & Carsten

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: If you are staying in New York and want to be near most of the attractions up town, do NOT stay here. However, if you dont mind catching the train or bus uptown, this is a pleasant place to stay.The staff are friendly and courteous, and the rooms are nicely decorated. No fridge, however there is an iron and ironing board. No kettle but there is a coffee pod thingo that also dispenses hot water. Walking distance to World Trade Centre and Battery Park and also for a stroll over the Brooklyn Bridge. Oh, they will also organise a transfer to JFK airport for $65 cash.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: On arrival the hotel lobby was being refurbished which left only two lifts available,reception staff was always friendly and helpful..  Room clean and comfortable however the bath was very small only used it once so not a big deal..Hotel has a wonderful roof top bar with a great view of the city great at night sitting out in the open watching the city come alive..Four points is situated 15mins from times square, we left the hotel at 9.00 each morning with a full day of activities.Visit included 911memorialStatue of liberty Natural history museum China town Brooklyn bridge Central park Central station Rockefeller centre *roof top bar amazing*Empire state building Little Italy 5th avenue Macy'sBroadway High line Harlem Chrysler building You have to try Joes pizza amazing All in 6 days amazing time, travelling at Easter was quite taxing due to the sheer amount of tourists be prepared to queue for each attraction fir at least 1 5 hrs..911 was over 2hrs good job I had my hand warmers lol, we decided to do empire state as late as possible as during the day the queue was a waiting time of 3hrs Loved it next visit will be night life with a bit of shopping thrown in...

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Really nice Saturday night's day using a third-party reservation. Super friendly front desk and other staff that made you feel welcome. Excellent comfy room as well.Special props to Calvin from the front desk for outstanding and friendly service at check-in and check-out. As I had traveled for good part of the day, I was very appreciative of a quiet room away from the elevator on a little bit higher floor. Also a great recommendation for the diner around the corner for comfort food. He also, upon checkout, put my bags in the back for extra security and care.Based on this stay, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again in the future as it is a perfect location for the downtown attractions and easy access to both subway and express buses to get every where you need to be.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Good location for those with business downtown. Room was comfortable, clean, modern. I generally stay in mid-town because I like to be in walking distance to the theaters and other attractions but I had business downtown and this worked out well.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice hotel, nice location able to walk & use public transport to get around New York. Rooms were clean & well stocked, staff were friendly & gave recommendations for restaurants within walking distance. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel to stay at near the Brooklyn bridge. Clean hotel but rooms are extremely tiny! Doesn’t matter if you truly are there to sleep and get ready in the room like we did. Beds are comfy and staff helpful, especially Dominique, she made sure our Anniversary was extra special. We walked the bridge and walked to 9/11 memorial. We took Uber’s at night to midtown to restaurants and lounges which was around $25 one way. Stouts bar next to hotel was cool chill spot we visited one afternoon on our way back from daytime outing. Bill’s burger was a good place to grab lunch down in the financial district while sightseeing 9/11 area. Don’t forget to get your parking ticket validated at hotel with parking garage next to hotel to pay less money if you have a car with you like we did. You end up saving about $20 a day with the parking this way.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Though the property is at a central location, walkable from freedom tower and downtown manhattan, the rooms are very cramped. We were a family of 4 and we had platinum membership. We were given a room with 2 double beds. With platinum membership the guy at the front desk was willing to give Breakfast coupon only for 2 ppl. This is rediculous when we were 4. But thanks to the good lady staff who gave as extra coupons so that all of us could have bf. And the bf was Al carte where you are given limited choices to choose from. There are plenty of other options nearby. Overall it was very average. Nothing exceptional.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: It was our first time to New York and it was a very pleasant experience, the room was clean, bed was comfortable. There was complementary tea and coffee. Location was awsome, near main sights in financial district, close also to the subway station which takes you to Times Square in less than 10 mins.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Not a welcoming hotel at all. Staff was average. When we booked we were told the room had two queens (no kings available) but the room had two doubles. Linens were nice and pillows were excellent. The room was tiny as was the bath.The shower was horrible as it did not drain properly so you ended up standing in soapy water. Will never book here again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here because my sister lives in a tiny apartment across the street so it was a matter of convenience. Wait for Gild Hall, 50 feet away, to run a last minute special and stay there. It’s well worth the extra $20. I stayed at four points during a visit last fall, and it wasn’t great, and things have gone down hill. The paint on the vanity in the bathroom is chipping, there was no soap in the bathroom (but two conditioner dispensers) and the cable tv went out twice during our 14 hour stay. An engineer had to come fix it both times. Also, we did get a “deal” on this thru bookings.com and they wouldn’t let me add my SPG number to get the points. Not technically required but would have been nice given the other customer service failures.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff were friendlyCheck in/ check out was easyRoom was clean, tidy and had most things needed. Was missing a little fridge though.Location was perfect - Walkable to Wall Street, Brooklyn Bridge, Boats for Statue of Liberty, Ground Zero and Metro Station (for all other major attractions). Also plenty of bars and restaurants around.I would recommend and will certainly be back to this hotel when next in NYC

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Newer hotel, small rooms, the four of us staying in a 2 double bed room barely got around the beds without stepping on each other. To little storage space for clothes, even just a few hooks would make things much better. Minus for noisy air conditioning turning on and off regularly during the night,waking us up (had to turn it off). Plus for usb sockets for easy charging of phones and pads,and for the hot tub, even though small.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The staff was amazing and super nice! The bed was so comfy I never wanted to get up. There are no major streets near by so it is nice and quiet at night for some good sleep. Yes the room is smaller than most hotels, but it is enough for sleeping and showering. What more do you need?

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is located in heart of downtown with Pearl street nearby and Fulton street subway station about 2 blocks away. It is well appointed, front desk service at checkin was good. The rooms are tiny - I have stayed in several NY hotels before and this has been the tiniest but other than our 4 suitcase lining the wall space it was cozy enough to get around. The best thing as I said was the location with rainy restaurants all around, USPS post office just around the corner. Trinidad consulate nearby. I caution however not to have room service which comes from the adjoining Ketch Brewhouse. The quality of the food and presentation were both awful and very overpriced. A $16 “continental” breakfast turned into a $29 bill with “assorted pastry” being two small dried danishes and a bowl of fruit with a orange rind drink garnish on top. Would I stay at the hotel again?- maybe yes. But avoid Ketch

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent central downtown location in the business area but so many tourist attractions and restaurants within walking distance Staff helpful and rooms clean, however, our room was tiny fortunately we only had one small suitcase. Did catch a glimpse of larger rooms so ask for one of them if staying any length of time.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here with a friend whilst visiting the city. Although not very central the hotel itself was very nice. Comfortable beds, tea and coffee making in the room. Good bathroom. The staff were very helpful with any requests we had. Breakfast was good.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at this hotel because of its location for a work meeting. Rooms were clean and in good shape but was disappointed with the service that I have come to expect as a Marriott Platinum member. Did not receive any of the benefits that are “typical” for a Platinum member. Would not give me a voucher for breakfast and ended up paying $50 for breakfast , which was absolutely terrible- cold coffee, instant oatmeal and fake eggs (do not eat at the hotel restaurant “Ketch”). Requested a king bed but we’re not able to accommodate me. The cleaning staff would not clean my room because I was working on my computer at the desk. Overall the hotel was fine for what I needed it but did not receive the typical Marriott service that I have come to expect.Probably would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Comfortable beds, clean room and friendly staff. The breakfast is great with an excellent waiter ! The lift can be busy and the reception level washroom was very dirty on one day. Friday night was a surpirse and welcome complimentaru glass of champagne evening.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The most remarkable point is the location of the hotel. The service was very good and the staff were so kind and helpful. The room space was acceptable and the bed comfortable. All in all I was satisfied with your services.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Financial District was very comfortable. The Front of house team were truly outstanding with their professionalism and courteous towards me. Extremely helpful, especially Brieah (apologies if name is spelt incorrectly). All members of the front of house team were very friendly and happy to answer any query that I had. I would give my room the three Cs, Clean, Comfortable and Concise! Although the room was compact, It was exactly what I needed as most of my time was used exploring New York. As the manager wrote in his welcome note, this was definitely a home from home experience. The Ketch Brewhouse restaurant is located next door, they are open until quite late. (I can't comment on the actual food/service as I didn't visit the restaurant).Due to the hotel being located in the Financial District meant it wasn't a busy as the Mid-Town areas of New York, once again this was perfect for me as I prefer quieter areas. There are regular trains 'Uptown' use either 2 or 3 trains! Overall, I had a very comfortable stay here.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at this hotel due to it's close proximity to the new Pier 17 for a couple of concerts we attended. Although the location was perfect, we had several issues with our room that were not resolved. The major issue was that our a/c wouldn't cool and only the fan would run. This left our room at 79 degrees when it was set on 67! We notified the front desk on our way out for the day and was assured someone would come take a look at it. When we arrived back at 10:30pm the room was the same temp and we had no notification if anyone had actually come to fix it. Since it was so late and we were due to leave the following morning we just let it go until checkout. Second issue was that housekeeping left NO clean towels one day and only left a note on the bed saying they would be delivered when available. We still had zero towels when we arrived back at 10:30 that night. After calling the front desk TWICE to request some, we finally got 2 bath towels an HOUR and 15 mins later! We were livid that we had to wait that long as we had just wanted to shower before getting into bed after having a hot/humid day in the city. Lastly, we also had one of the vanity light bulbs go out in the bathroom, and even after notifying the front desk it was not taken care of. I complained to the front desk about our issues when we checked out and they took my friend's email since she had reserved our room and mentioned possibly getting a discount of some sort, but I really doubt that will happen given how they couldn't even follow through on any of these issues. I highly recommend booking another hotel even though this one is a good location and decent price simply for the poor customer service!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Easy access to water side, to other districts via yellow cab or metro.Becarefull with hotel can service it is not perfect and you might end up with other people i would advise to take a yellow can to go to airport

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Where do I begin...a group of us girls booked two rooms with two queen size beds from Thursday July 26 to Monday July 30th. As the manager was checking us in she said we did not have any rooms booked in your name...of course we were confused because we have the emails to prove we booked two rooms, two beds for this hotel. For 20mins one of my friend is going back and forth with the Manager, Dominque, at front desk trying to confirm information. The manager finally gets it correct but we still had to wait another hour to check in and get our key cards. We finally checked in and head to our rooms and this is when things go all the way wrong...Both of our rooms had one bed...ONE BED!! So we had 4 girls in one room and 5 and the other room. Which is WHY WE BOOKED TWO ROOMS WITH TWO QUEEN SIZE BEDS!! We go back to front desk and the associate not the manager claimed we booked two rooms with one bed room. Of course we knew that info was wrong because we have email confirmations stating otherwise. My friend is going back and forth with the people at the front desk and one point they DID NOT want to compensate or compromise. The whole room situation was an inconvenience because they over booked and could not give us what we booked. We couldn’t do anything about that. We were promised extra pull out beds but NEVER GOT ANY. We would ask for towels it would take 30mins to come to our rooms. At one point we asked for towels and the associate got an attitude about us wanting 6 towels. So customer service was bad, however the only person that was nice to us and did his best to make sure we got what we needed was Calvin. When we talked to him he was able to get us one pull out bed and was able to authorize a lower rate for our hotel stay. He was very sweet and his service was great. I can’t speak on the other people we encounter b/c they gave us hell. For a lot of us in the group this was our first time in NYC and to have a bad experience with this hotel was devastating. We will not be booking at this hotel ever again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: When I stayed at this property it was $468 for the cheapest room. What an awful slap in the face to have to pay that for a Four Points. However the hotel was near to a meeting that I wanted to attend so I sucked it up and paid.The building didn't seem in terribly great shape given how old it really is - it's a fairly new build but certainly doesn't feel like it on the inside. Elevator's could be painstakingly long to wait for to get you down to the lobby.The front desk staff were delightful. At least I got five star front desk service for this price!Breakfast not so delightful. No one was manning the entrance. Was seated, ordered my meal and staff tried THREE times to remove my plates before I had finished. In the end I let them take away food I wanted to eat because I was tired of swatting them away. I have no idea what their problem was given the restaurant was empty and I was there for less than half an hour so I can't understand the rush of throwing me out. Maybe they could occupy themselves with waiting at the front entrance to seat diners instead of annoying the ones who made it in?If you can get a reasonable price for this hotel, I would recommend it (I would probably go somewhere else for breakfast if you can though, the food was nothing special and the staff too imposing). Leave your room five minutes earlier than planned in case you get stuck waiting for the elevators.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I booked this location in error, but it turned out to be a great experience. I loved the public park/sitting area out front, as well as the onsite restaurant. The staff was very pleasant and professional.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Had 7 nights at this hotel. 1. night we got a handicap room with a door into another room. Very loud between these 2 rooms so we asked for a change. Got another room in 27'th floor. Very nice!Overall a good experience.What could be better? Cleaning each day.. A lack of attention for details. 1 day they left some of the cleaning equipments and placed water bottles on floor.We also missed a little more help from the front desk.When leaving we did not get much information whether we should take train or cab

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: this hotel was very convenient on my business trip, was close to the client site as well as the metro station to take me around Manhattan.They don't have a pantry if you want to buy a quick snack or drinks but there is a 7eleven around the corner.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: When you are in Manhattan as a tourist, you should stay in midtown rather than downtown. We chose this downtown hotel only because we were transiting through this city. The hotel has old carpets, which give it a tired look. The room was too small. The bed was just okay. The view from the hotel was nothing to talk about. An average hotel...

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Well located in lower Manhattan near the financial district and the South street sea port area, the Four Points offers a value proposition for the canny traveller. The hotel has 28 levels but only 11 rooms per floor so it occupies a small foot print. Being small means that there are not a lot of guests milling around the reception or foyer area. Staff were friendly and efficient fixing an issue that we had swiftly. The rooms themselves are compact but offering modern amenities and furnishings. Beds were comfortable but the pillows a bit on the soft side. Bathroom was also compact but had a bath and of course a toilet. As our family was out all day, all we needed was a bed, shower and toilet. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel but plenty of eateries are located around the hotel including the Fulton street supermarket where sushi and hot buffet style food was available. If and when we return to NYC, we will definitely stay at the Four Points again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My friends and I stayed here for a stagette. The rooms are very small it wasn’t good for sharing but everything in New York is pricey and small so it’s a good Basic hotel it will do the job if you are trying to not spend a lot. The restaurant downstairs has really good food and you can also order it as room service. It’s in the financial district so there’s not much to see there. I would recommend if you are going to New York for the first time spend more and stay in time square it was my favourite place in nyc. The staff at the hotel are super friendly and you feel very safe inside and welcomed. There are a lot of sketchy places in New York so just travel with someone and it’s very easy to get lost. I personally found that a lot of ppl in the city were not helpful or friendly so you felt very much on your own. I had a much better experience in London. However New York night life is great just find a promoter before you go on instagram and your life will be a lot easier! You do get complimentary coffee in the morning at this hotel and lots of breakfast places are close by as well as the subway and it’s not far if you want an Uber downtown.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for two nights in a room with a king bed on the 10th floor. It’s a standard spg hotel. The kind of hotel you can be assured that you’ll get a good night rest at. The rooms are small, which is expected for any hotel in NYC at the same price range. The bed was comfy. The room was clean enough although the washroom had some drain flies. We requested for a small fridge for our toddler’s milk and the hotels response was very prompt. The hotel provides water bottles for free. Location is good, although we did not explore immediate surroundings much. All in all, it’s a place to sleep. The room is just big enough to house the bed. There’s nothing else you can really do nor is there any space. You’re in NYC after all, so I’d imagine you’d want to be outside in the city anyway.I will add that customer service was top notch. Very polite, respectful, friendly and helpful. You don’t get this everywhere and solely because of this, I would consider staying here again in the future.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We travelled as a family of 4 (with luggage).The room we had was a reasonable size,but insufficient cupboard / drawer space for all of us.The room itself was spotlessly clean, and serviced on a daily basis (you can opt-out of daily, if you feel it's not required, and there is a small bonus for doing this).All of the staff that we engaged with were extremely pleasant and helpful.It's ideally situated in the Downtown area (approx 10 - 15 minutes walk from Battery Park) or 15 - 20 (strolling) gets you to the Brooklyn Bridge. Other than that, it's close to Fulton St Metro Station, which connects you to basically the main Uptown lines (if you're heading for Times Square etc.).Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed at the Four Points on Platt and Gold Street Downtown Manhattan on four occasions for business in 2018 so far. The rates vary depending on the day of the week and time of year, but overall found them to be reasonable and I think you get more value for money. The room size is good, along with the service, cleanliness of rooms, sufficient storage and power points. Less than 300m from the office, it was very convenient. The only down side was once when I ordered room service for breakfast, fruit and a croissant, it was fairly poor, the tea was cold and for $20 - expensive. I’ve also stayed at the Marriott, which is also good, but always more expensive for the same standard as the Sheraton and Club Quarters, which is absolutely awful, avoid if you can. Definitely recommend the Four Points.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My room had a shower tap that fell off the moment I tried to turn it on. No water came out. After three failed attempts to call for service, I finally managed to get through. A technician came up, declared he needed support, went down, came up, declared he needed guidance, called someone and decided I had to wait till the next morning for it to be fixed. The hotel wanted to move me to another room but I had unpacked for the day, it was almost midnight and I was exhausted so I asked for another room (402) just for my shower, and they could fix the shower the following day. The next day (today, Jun 10), I reminded the (different) counter staff about my ordeal. I told them I would go out till about 1pm and they could try to fix it. If they couldn’t, please leave a note so I know what the outcome was, as it was so difficult to get anyone to pick up the phone when I called. When I returned, there was no note. I decided to go out again to give them more time. By the time I got back to my room for the night at about 7pm I tried the shower. It still didn’t work and there was still no note or communication from staff. I decided to go to room 402 for my shower, only to realise to my dismay the hotel cancelled my access to my shower room without telling me before. So I had to now go back to the lobby to ask them for an update. This third staff had no idea what happened so I had to explain it all over again. She insisted that I had to change my rooms as the hotel needed more than 2 days to repair the tap. When I packed and moved my luggage to the other room and collected my new key card, I had not a single word of apology, even though I thanked them for the card (but not for all the misery and inconvenience I’d never encountered in my 15 years of international business travel, let alone from a Sheraton property). Guys, things break down. I get it. But service recovery is all it takes. Apologise, show sincerity and empathy for the troubles you’ve created for your guests and try to make it up to them. I struggle to believe I have to say this to an international chain in an international city.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is just a few block from Fulton Center Metro Station, which means that is very easy to take the Metro in every direction and line. There is also very close to Wall Street, the Oculus and the 9/11 Memorial. Also at walking distance of Battery Park. The hotel is simple and practical. Rooms are comfortable and service is good enough.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The lobby resembled a police station, ugly, no flowers. No welcoming anything! The room was claustrophobic, with not even one glass, only plastic and styrofoam. We paid around $250 for this depressing closet of a room. This was are second stay but forgot about the first until the taxi driver finally found the darkened corner that is Platt Street. There is no bar. There is one next door which is just okay but nothing about this experience was good. Not what you except with a big name like Sheridan. There are way nicer and less expensive places to stay in NYC. Don’t waste your money. If you are there on business and your boss is paying you can deal but nothing luxurious about this hole of a hotel.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This Sheraton is a few blocks from South Street Seaport in downtown Manhattan. It is co-located with a restaurant but does not offer breakfast with room rate. There is a small but nice gym on the lower floor, and the rooms are super small (standard for manhattan) but clean and equipped with coffee maker. Perfect option for exploring the city, and this part of town is much more commercial than it was just a few years ago. Nice coffee shops and a Joe and the Juice are right nearby.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Pros: the beds are comfortable; the hotel is newly remodeled.Cons: billing issues; hotel management, SPG customer service. My husband and I spent two nights at this property in April. We called SPG directly and booked a “corner king, city view room.” Apparently, the booking came thru to the hotel as a standard room. We had a view of what looked like the interior of an elevator shaft. This was our honeymoon. Akim at the front desk offered to knock $40 / night off the rate to make up for the inconvenience, promised me that he would be working when we checked, and that he would take care of everything. He was not working the morning when we checked out (Sunday). The bill came in at a higher nightly rate than initially agreed upon, with no discount given, and two additional and unaccounted for $50 and $80+ charges. I asked to speak with a manager and was told there was no manager on sight. I asked for a business card for the general manager and was told one would have to be handwritten, as he doesn’t have business cards (his name is Arthur Cheung). Theresa, at the front desk, talked to me about options and offered to “hug it out” with me. I declined. Theresa then attempted to modify my bill but after three failed attempts told me she would have to get someone above her to correct the bill and assured me that it would be rectified by 7pm that evening. At 5:30pm I received a “revised and final” bill from the property that changed nothing. Theresa emailed me the next day (Monday) saying that billing had been taken out of her hands but that people were looking into the issue. Theresa’s email was the final communication I received from the hotel. The next day (Tuesday) I called SPG and spoke with two different CSRs, Jessica and Derrick, before being transferred to a supervisor, John, who assured me that everything would be taken care of within 48 hours, during which time I would hear directly from the hotel. 72 hours later, I had heard nothing from John or anyone at the hotel so I called SPG again only to be told that John wasn’t working. Pilar, who I spoke with, offered me a choice of 10,000 SPG points or a $100 refund check that would take up to 21 days to arrive. I opted for the money. 33 days later I had still not received a check from SPG, so I called and spoke with another Jessica who transferred me to a supervisor, Louise, who told me that the check had only been submitted for processing 6 days prior (that's 27 days, if you're counting), but she would request that it be mailed ASAP. I asked Louise if she thought this customer service experience was acceptable; she declined to answer. I asked what SPG might do to retain me as a customer going forward and again Louise had no answer. She then offered me 3,000 points, thanked me for calling SPG, and hung up.If anyone from SPG corporate wants to rectify this absurd situation I am happy to be contacted. Until then, I plan on avoiding the Four Points by Sheraton Downtown NYC and all other SPG / Marriott properties unless someone else is footing the bill. If you're reading this review, you might want to do the same.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We booked this hotel for the Memorial Day long weekend. But it doesn't live up to a 3 star hotel status. The lobby is the best part of the hotel and everything after that is average/below average. The rooms are not that big in size (which is acceptable being in NY City). In terms of cleanliness, the room was okay but the bathroom was reeking of bad odor. As we were staying just for one night, we dint bother to address this as we were exhausted with the sightseeing. Overall, I would suggest to look at other hotels and go for this if you don't have other options and location is your priority.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This mid priced hotel presents a walkable scenario through out the Financial district into Soho and beyond based on your stamina. Located at Platt and Gold street these one-way streets minimize traffic congestion in the area. We were there on a weekend which mean it was very quiet and easy to move around. The property is about a 10-12 minute walk to the World Trade Centre Memorial and the PATH Transport Hub. This Hub can be your starting point to anywhere in Manhattan with lines to New Jersey and Brooklyn. Metro card is a must, easy to obtain and reload as required.The Hotel itself was well staffed, friendly and helpful with questions to get around. Rooms-ours anyway small King but very comfortable bed; shower only and clean. Great HD Television. Hotel has zero tolerance for party time demonstrated by the waiver at the front desk. Thai and Indian restaurants within a few minutes walk plus a host of fast food. Reservation was made with booking.com and rates will vary by day. As an example our Sunday rate was 140USD and Monday was 441USD. Rates fluctuate by demand. This property may be an advantage as the financial district is generally closed on the weekend. Free morning coffee in the lobby. I would return to this property. New York is great!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I am completely frustrated with SPG. I booked a room in NY as I normally do through Tivago. When I called Starwood to extend my stay I got a rep on the phone who told me that the hotel was booked but recommended another Starwood property. I was going to book through Trivago but he assured me that I would get the best rate. Phooey, Starwood reps lie, then the hotel, The Four Points Sheraton Downtown NYC refused to honor the rate and would not cancel the reservation so I could book on Trivago. The difference in price was almost $100 a night. I cant believe (1) Starwood lets reps lie (2) treats customers this way and is an all out rip off. DO NOT BOOK THROUGH THE SITE OR ON THE PHONE UNLESS YOU WANT TO PAY WAY TOO MUCH!!!!! #starwood #ripoff #liedto #boycottSPG

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Came in about 2hrs early for check in no rooms available so we got a bite to eat. Came back before check in time and room was ready. Room is a bit small but reading reviews it was expected. King bed, decent city view, 25th floor, no fridge but had a room safe. Front desk service was good, people friendly. Staff took the time to help with directions and how to use the subway. This place has no pool or hot tub but it is a business hotel.I tried the room service one night and it was typical room service fair. I got the hamburger and fries and a piece of cheese cake. The fries were not very good the burger was just okay. The cheese cake was a very disappointing slice to price ratio and was just okay like something out of a cafeteria. Was not impressed New York cheese cake.Overall the hotel was very good, service very good skip the restaurant. If you have a AARP card use it it was the cheapest way to go for the room. Would come back again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff: courteousWifi connection: decentlocation: decent if you're working in the area. About a 5-10 minute walk from the closest subway.Room size and price: shoebox room where you could barely open a suitcase on the floor.This hotel is ridiculously over-priced relative to the tiny size of the rooms. Traveling throughout Asia you will get rooms two or three times the size in a Hilton or a Ritz Carlton in the business district for the same or a fraction of the price. Not only that, but breakfast wasn't included and you have to pay taxes on top.It's fine if you are only visiting on business and only plan to spend sleeping hours in the hotel. I wouldn't stay here if I was visiting on holiday.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Easy and polite check in. Allocated room on 5th floor accessible by lift. The room was large enough although some people found them small. King size bed and large t.v in room with tea and coffee making facilities replenished every day. Good size bathroom with great shower and plenty towels.As we were out every day so we had no complaints about the room and it was quiet at night.Would certainly use it again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I had a stay on 4/10 at the hotel. The rate I stayed for that night is agreed at $350.I checked out on 4/11. Later on 4/14 found out that the hotel charged $350 on 2 separate credit cards that I did not authorized them to.Informed the hotel on the same day. They told me that they will do a reversal. It eventually occurred on 4/17, reflected/posted to my credit card account finally on 4/26.This is no joke, the hotel did steal money. And they offer no explanation or apology on how they are able to make the unauthorized charges on separate credit cards for the same amount.Had I not go through my credit card bills, this hotel would have been successful.Usually when unauthorized charge happens on the same credit card, it is easy to spot. Not the way they are stealing from me this time, on two separate cards.You will want to be extra careful checking your bill here.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice location close to Pier 11, Water Street, and lots of great sites to walk to. Very nice rooms, comfortable bed, quiet location and nice staff. Located away from crazy but Uber, taxi, and transit right there to take you back to crazy. Love NY City!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: To start, Dominique, at the front desk was so awesome. She went above and beyond! She was friendly, accommodating and very professional! Management !! Pay Attention! This young lady provides quality customer service! The room is comfortable and fits the need of a family of 3 adults visiting the big apple.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Good location for price, the Fi Di seems to be busy with construction/development - none of which impacted our stay. Well connected to the rest of Manhattan and Brooklyn.The room was comfortable, and reasonably spacious - the bed was huge, great for stretching out. The shower pressure was disappointing, but as far as bathroom facilities go we couldn't complain. Staff were all helpful and friendly, and the food from the adjoining Ketch Bar/Restaurant was tasty. Plenty other cafes/restaurants/bars in the surrounding area.I would book the Four Points again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We arrived in the evening and Theresa was our receptionist. We felt really welcome and she offered great service! Hotel is nice and comfortable. Rooms are clean, nice bed en good shower. Breakfast is expensive but good!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for a week on business mixed with some tourism. The price was US$ 185 all included, so not high but....--Worst: I could not access my business email on their computers. I could with my tablet but it is not functional for longer things. I told them and told them and told them, and they just did nothing about it. They tried to tell me it was the problem of my programme until I told them I have used the same in hotels and internet cafes and  so on all over the world including many third world countries.--the drain in the tub didn't work--had to talk to them three times--the phone system didn't work--the rooms (first a double with a colleague and then a king bed) were very small--there was almost no storage--one drawer and a small half closet--the heating was faulty. I had to turn it up to 78F to get it to heat up. It kept on closing off. In the first room I had it was cold for three nights.--no information on tv system, so if I wanted to know what was on I had to scroll through all of them and watch for a while..Why was there no channel with what's on?On the plus side----location is good--staff were kind--bed and linens very comfortableSo, all in all, it was comfortable and convenient, but so many little things were just annoying and the worst was the management did not follow up.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed recently for 4 nights and have to say we really enjoyed our visit. Location was great for sightseeing, close to subway. Reception and bar staff great , bar staff in particular took the time to get to know us over the few days and were very personable. We were a little dissapointment the rooftop bar wasn’t open but hey we’re adults so we got on with enjoying ourselves. Bed amazing and room very clean. Would have no hesitation in staying again. Thanks to all the Staff.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Came here for my daughters 21st birthday and chose this hotel for the rooftop bar (see hotel stock picture) when we booked in we asked what time the rooftop bar opened they informed us that it is only available for special occasions-this was the single reason we booked this hotelThe staff here are indifferent, we were there 3 days and I couldn’t say that any of the staff struck me as warmThe rooms are on the small side but I guess this is NY, the beds were comfortable but again quite small (would have preferred one larger bed rather than 2 small doubles) the showers took a long tome to warm up tooThere is free internet though and it was quite fastIt is about $20 away from time square by Uber

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Hard to find amongst all the construction and high risers,parking pay 35$, rooms very small, 29 floors high, views from our 19 th floor room was of other high risers, no breakfast, room besides being small is nice and modern,

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I haven’t been to New York since the fall. The prices in the new year is much more reasonable. I stayed here for less than 150. The room was a lot better than before. The ac was quiet and the staff was great. I slept well and would return.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I have stayed here several times and have found it to be conveniently located, reasonably priced with standard accommodations. The walls can be a bit thin, so if you have a loud neighbor, you will hear it, but otherwise you should be fine.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: excellent location! attentive, kind staff! clean, large rooms! the restaurant is very good and not expensive! thanks for the excellent services! next time we will be sleeping here!One World Center - 500mWall Street - 100mBattery Park - 700mFulton Street Metro Station - 400mOcullus - 500mExcellent! Thank you so much!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed for eight days on holiday. The hotel is located less than five minutes from the Fulton Street subway station (where most lines stop) and about 10 minutes walk from the World Trade Center PATH station, that is convenient for going to and from Newark airport. The hotel is also near Brooklyn Bridge, the WTC memorial, the ferries to the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island/Staten Island and other sights. There are plenty of shops nearby (for groceries, the Jubilee Market Place in John St is excellent), and there's numerous places to eat within a block or two.Check-in was friendly and efficient. As we stayed on a dirt-cheap rate we got a rather small room with no view to speak of. The double bed was HUGE and very comfortable. Floor space was quite limited, but enough for our two large and two small suitcases. There was a large TV with plenty of channels, and a coffee maker (I preferred the free coffee in the reception, as the in-room machine made quite awful coffee). There was a small desk and sufficient storage space for clothes - we missed some clothes pegs in the room, though.The bathroom had a basin, a mirror and a shower (of the stupid variety with a fixed shower head). The water pressure could have been better - turning this down to save energy does not help when you have to stay twice as long in the shower to rinse off.The air conditioning was easy to adjust, but quite noisy! The first night we woke up when it turned on, as we thought someone entered the room. There was very little noise to be heard from the outside, though (this might be different in a front-facing room on a low floor).Housekeeping was mostly good. The hotel has a system where you hang a special sign on the door if you don't need housekeeping, this is supposed to give you a restaurant voucher. We never got those. Also, when we pulled out the bed from the wall on the last night to check if we had dropped anything behind it, we found lots of dust bunnies and leftover stuff from previous guests. Some of these items vere quite unpleasant to find, but as we had stayed one week already we did not take the offer of having the room thoroughly cleaned.I'd be happy to come back, but the hotel should improve their cleaning routine. Looking behind the bed should not make you feel you work in a forensics unit.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Centrally located to financial district and World Trade Center. Large number of restaurants in the area to provide lots of choice. Staff were successful in doing their best to meet our needs. Suite was spacious and well maintained. High floor location - good sleep each night. Calvin, at the front desk, took good care of us. The hotel's design is not the best as it relates to storage however that has nothing to do with the staff - things as simple as hooks for pajamas and drawer space were missing.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Spent 2 weeks here last year on business on recommendation from numerous colleagues who have used this hotel on trips. Excellent location for the financial district, close enough to the main roads, but tucked away enough to get a bit of peace and quite. A nice contrast from staying in the city center and you can actually enjoy a quiet nights sleep. The staff are friendly and polite and very helpful. The bar connected to the Sheraton isn't too bad,the restaurants located on the block are pretty good. Felice restaurant rght across the street does a lovely little avocado and poached egg breakfast. Close to the Fulton Street subway which provides easy connection to anywhere. To give you an idea, its about 20 mins away from Madison Sqr Garden. Walking distance to the waterfront for beautiful views, close to the Westfeilds, Century 21, 9/11 Memorial and museum. Wifi is great in room and outside as well as restaurant and bar.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel, very clean and very friendly staff, the ladies on reception go above and beyond for you. Rooms were nice with the most comfortable beds I have EVER slept on! Bar connected to the hotel does good food and drinks, we had amazing service by Fabian. It was about 20 minutes by cab to times square but there are plenty of things around within walking distance. I would recommend visiting the Coyote Ugly bar when in New York (about 15 minutes in cab from the hotel). I would definitely recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay here again. Thank you!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I recently had to head to NYC for a family matter and booked this hotel on short notice. I didn't have much time to review first, so I was a little nervous. However, the hotel is wonderful. Nothing fancy, but the beds are comfortable, the rooms are a decent size, everything is clean and the staff is helpful and friendly. The one downside is the restaurant. The food is just ok (except for the mozzarella sticks, which are the best I've ever had!!!) and it is way overpriced. The hotel is in a good location (seaport is nearby if you are looking for touristy things, and the 6 train is a short walk and that will get you to most uptown points and Brooklyn). Parking is available at a garage right behind the hotel for a reasonable fee. Overall, it was a great experience.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: As an business hotel, near the tip of Manhattan, this ideal. The price is good, the rooms are nice, and the staff pleasant. There isn't much in the way of additional services. It's not a destination hotel. The Fulton Street subway provides easy connection to 'everywhere'.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: enjoyed the location of the hotel, the room amenities, comfort of bed, the front desk staff attitude very good Although I feel that I received fare value for the cost of the stay the room is extremely small as a single traveler had difficulty moving around in the room also no explanation how to change setting of a/c no listing of the various tv channels

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I checked into the hotel Tuesday evening and when unpacking noticed that a button was missing from my dress shirt. I asked the front desk for assistance and, although it was 30 degrees outside, the front desk manager, Theresa Mazzocca, went shopping for a needle and thread. She then proceeded to sew the button on again bu,t when she discovered that the button was broken, she took a button from her shirt to replace it. I've been traveling for business for over 40 years and this was the best customer service by far!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights following a cruise , was honestly worried after reading some of the reviews, but... Front desk were helpful , went out of their way to look after us offered a choice of room, booked taxis etc, helped with directions and advice and walking routes how to get to places. . Room plenty big enough, clean , tea and coffee replenished daily, free bottled water, bathroom with good quality toiletries,ate in the bistro once , expensive but good service. wouldnt hesitate to stay again,considering location no noise

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Prior to my arrival on January 21,2018, I made requests on my reservation and called the hotel directly to confirm my requests before my arrival. I was relieved that my message was passed onto staff members (front desk and housekeeping) and as I was being checked in by Dominique, she let me know that what I had asked for was already in the room! I was happy that the staff members took the time to do this. Dominique and the rest of the front desk staff I met during my one night stay were always courteous and respectful. Keep up the good work.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Arrived on January 2nd at 4 pm. All of the New Years drama having already finished, I was expecting to be able to get a decent room upgrade being SPG Gold member. No offer/mention was made at check-in but I was feeling relaxed so initially didn't say anything. Upon seeing the room (very small, zero view and strange removable wall panel which reveals the guts of a heater. Went back downstairs front desk guy (Indian dude) was eating and took like 20 seconds to finish eating his bite before he could speak told me there were no upgrades yet available (IT'S ALREADY 4:30 PM!) Fine no upgrade, we booked an UBER and asked same guy where is the pickup point. He has no idea!? This guy is useless. Turns out we had to walk five blocks to our ride. Maybe it was an off day, but not going to stay here again to find out. Awful staff.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Firstly I booked my trip through British Airways as part of a package deal. On reading the reviews I was concerned about the size of the rooms but I didn’t need to worry too much. The size of the room was good enough for what we needed after all you don’t book a trip to stay in your room the whole time. We arrived on the 2nd January and was greeted by a friendly member of staff who checked us in very quickly. We were give room 1507 a double corner room. The bed was very comfortable and seemed really high but didn’t have any problems sleeping. The air conditioning/heating system was really noisy but after speaking to people who we met thi seemed like a normal problem regardless of hotel they were staying in. Teas/coffees/water supplied every day in the room as well as during the day a coffee station in reception (great idea). Bathroom was very cold though so a quick shower and dressed. The location is superb for all attractions we purchased a 7 day metro card for $32 each and we certain,y got our value out of this card even though we weren’t staying for 7 days. Easy to use and enjoyed riding the subway. There are restaurants and bars in the area go out and venture and find these places everyone is so welcoming. You won’t be disappointed. I would highly recommend this hotel and we have already decided that if we come back when the weather is warmer we will for definite rebook this hotel again. Thank you for making our stay so great and being so welcoming

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: After reading mixed reviews prior to our stay I was open minded about what to expect, but I was not disappointed! The check in was quick and simple, the lovely lady who was working on the hotel reception desk on 26/12/17 was extremely welcoming and helpful, she offered us maps of the area and gave us some directions to some local places where we could get food after a long day of travelling. We stayed on the 11th floor which was fine, elevator access was fast and efficient. Our room was bigger than I had expected based on the reviews, but was big enough for what we needed it for (a base) I mean who goes to New York to sit in a room? Storage was a slight problem, we all lived out of the suitcases and stored them near to the door which was not a huge problem to be honest, the complimentary tea, coffee and water was gratefully received and was replenished every day, there was one occasion where they forgot to leave the coffee pods but we mentioned it to the staff on reception and they sent a staff member up with them within minutes. The hotel has free wifi which was great for the kids and also computers and a printer in the main Reception. Complimentary tea and coffee is also available in the hotel lobby. The rooms were cleaned every day to a high standard and fresh towels replenished daily. The beds were large and spacious and extremely comfortable!! I do not usually sleep well away from home but i had no trouble this time! Being downtown it was very quiet at night and peaceful, there was no noise at all from the streets below and I did not even hear anything from our neighbouring rooms either, this was a huge plus! We loved the location as it was within 5-10 minutes walking distance from lots of attractions including 9/11 memorial, battery park, statue of liberty ferry, wall street and Brooklyn Bridge, also the local subway Fulton Street is 5 mins away which can get you to wherever you want to go within 10-20 mins. The Ketch Brewhouse which is part of the hotel is a lovely, friendly place with some great happy hour deals and the food is reasonable and very very nice!! Fabian was particularly attentive and could not do enough for us. So on the whole I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and I would definitely go back!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The corner king room was a good size; however, it took a long time for the room to heat up and there is no heating vent in the bathroom, so on a very cold morning, the bathroom was freezing - not what I'd expect in a hotel of this level. I believe the person who checked me in was new and I was not offered my gold welcome amenity. When I called down to the lobby in the morning to request a late check out, the phone rang for a while with no answer, so I had to head down to the lobby. It seems they might be short staffed. It's a bit frustrating when you try to stay loyal to a brand, especially when comparable hotels cost less, and they fall short of expectations in terms of service.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I’d expect to give 4 stars to a FPBS hotel, but not this time. There were too many minuses here. The hotel is in the heart of the financial area, close to Battery Park and the Brooklyn Bridge. The little square it’s located in is a bit scruffy though. Our check in was dreadful. Two more unwelcoming staff members you couldn’t imagine, but next morning it was a complete change with two very lovely staff at reception. Our room was very small but the bed was very comfortable. However there was no heating in the bathroom so we had to keep the door open so it got vaguely warm. Room service was poor. Beverages weren’t always replenished, and it didn’t look like it was cleaned very thoroughly. I think we’d make a different hotel choice next time.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a good hotel, which best feature is the close proximity to the subway (a 5 to 7 minute walk). My room was very small, but I knew that going in. The shower stall is also a bit narrow with the placement of the shampoo/body wash dispensers. My only real complaint about the room was the heating unit, which was loud when turning on and off. I eventually turned the heat off when I went to sleep and huddled under the blankets as the unit kept waking me up. I did not report this to the staff as it seemed to be a flaw with the model and not the unit itself.There are numerous places to eat within a few blocks, and the hotel restaurant also features reasonably priced appetizers and dinners, and serves food until midnight. The bartender who served me the night I went was extremely friendly and attentive. The diner right around the corner has a great breakfast as well.Overall, a wonderful staff and a great location to stay.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Not 4 star by a long shot. Room was really small, by small I mean I couldn’t open one of the bed side draws and couldn’t sit straight on the toilet. Show pressure was weak and the shower stopped 6 times. Asked reception who sent a guy up who just changed the setting.Don’t waste your money, I wish I had gone back to the Marriott in Greenwich St. Wish I could get my money back.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We paid about $300 (after including taxes and fees) per night, and I was a little disappointed in the room. It was pretty small, but I suppose that’s what southerners like me can expect from Manhattan. The bathroom was spacious, clean, and well-stocked. The room didn’t have much of a view as the window just looks out at another building. The location was excellent though. I highly recommend staying in the financial district because you’ll be away from all the crowded areas farther north. Plus, you’ll be close to tourist attractions like the WTC, Oculus, and 9/11 memorial. Everything else is a subway ride away.So in summary, the location was excellent, the room was smaller than I had hoped, the staff was friendly, but the value just wasn’t there. $300/night for a queen bed is a lot of money, and the superb location doesn’t justify spending that much.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This place is a dump. Smells like trash. Old, tired building, filthy carpets, horrible smell in the hallways, unfriendly staff. My "upgraded" room had a crack in the balcony door. I hated every day I stayed there.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is very well located, close to trains, restaurants, at a mix of businesses and residential area. I was there for only one night, I have been to other similar hotels in the city and in the area but I had never been to this one and decided to give it a try. As a SPG gold member, I was very well greeted, the front desk team was very receptive and welcoming. The room was clean and I found it a very good quality-price ratio. Knowing that I was going to be out and about that night, I requested a late check out, which was granted until 4 pm. To my surprise, and only complain, the cleaning crew starts knocking and/or opening your room door literally every hour after 10 am despite the fact that the “later” label was outside door. It seems like there’s a little bit of a disconnect between the front desk and everyone else, or that housekeeping don’t really care if the “later” sign is outside, or if you already told them 4 times to come back later, don’t worry, they will keep coming until you finally get upset enough to leave the premises, restless, and with a bad taste in your mouth. So my advice is that if you’re planning on sleeping later than 10 am, you might want to stay somewhere else.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Brief notes:- Tiny room (even by NY standards)- No place to store/unpack clothes- Loud and confusing A/C- Drafty window kept the room freezing- Curtains open the wrong way, blocking 75% of the view and outdoor light when they're "open."- Horrible pillows and cheap TPI travel to New York's Financial District every six weeks and use a "secret hotel" website to save money on my hotel costs. After making this trip dozens of times, I've stayed at every 3.5-4.5 star hotel in the area, and can guess the hotel based on the amenities and rating in the website listing. For my most recent trip earlier this week, I booked one I didn't recognize and ended up at the Sheraton Four Points New York Downtown. I was looking forward to the stay because I hadn't been there before, but two nights at this hotel has convinced me to stick with the hotels I know from now on. On arrival, the front desk staff was friendly and welcoming, but told me that my reservation in their system showed me arriving the following night. This was even after I called the hotel the previous night to confirm the reservation for the dates on the booking confirmation email from the website. Also, they told me the credit card I gave them for incidentals was rejected, but I found out later it was perfectly fine. When I got to the room, I was shocked by how tiny it was, even by NYC standards. There was only enough room to walk around the bed. There was a desk with an upholstered cube tucked underneath in lieu of a proper chair, and a small bench under the window with a single tiny drawer for folded clothes. I set my carry-on suitcase on that bench to unpack, then realized that there was nowhere to hang up clothes. There was a wardrobe about 14 inches in width with a small hook screwed to the back, on which two hangers were hung. No bar, just the hook. After looking around for an actual closet, I realized that this is where they were expecting people to hang up their clothes. I have never stayed at a hotel that doesn't provide a bar - somewhere, anywhere - for hanging up clothes, including 2.5 - 3 star hotels in warm-weather leisure destinations where one could argue you wouldn't need it. Who during the design of this hotel decided that this would be acceptable in Downtown New York City, arguably the epicenter of the global business?In the far corner of the room was a corner window with a great view, 75% of which was blocked by curtains that opened inward toward the corner rather than out past the edges of the window. The area around the window was incredibly drafty, leaving the entire room freezing unless the heater was running. The heater vent was on the other side of the room from the window, with the bed in the middle, so at night I was either freezing cold or stifling hot. The AC/heater was also so loud that it woke me up several times. Also, operation of the AC in the room required a room key to be placed in a slot by the door, but I wasn't told about this at check-in and there were no instructions on the thermostat, so I initially thought the heater was broken.Finally, the pillows were by far the most uncomfortable I've ever encountered. There were four of them on the bed and all four stacked up, when pressed down under my head, barely equaled the thickness and support of a normal pillow.I am sure that I was given this room because I took advantage of the "secret hotel" deal the hotel offered on a well-known booking website, if only because there's no way this hotel would still be in business if every guest's experience was like mine. I have suspected this is a common practice and temper my expectations accordingly, but the rooms I'm assigned by other hotels in the area are spacious and luxurious compared to my room at the Sheraton Four Points New York Downtown. I will never stay there again, even at a third of the price I paid on this trip.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for four nights at the start of December. Enjoyed our stay for the value, as with any hotel there are positives and negatives. Positives:Location - I have perviously stayed (2 visits) in midtown near the main attractions but at this time of year they were all ridiculously expensive. This hotel was a great price and the location had plenty to offer. I found the financial district great. Literally no walk to Ground Zero, Stanton Island ferry etc. Very easy access to Fulton Subway which meant midtown and Central Park were only 15 min awayGreat bars - there are some great bars and restaurants to visit. The highly recommended Dead Rabbit (one of the best in New York) it’s just round the corner Bed - mega comfy, excellent nights sleep Plugs / USB charging - so many! These days this is a must and the room delivers (and some)Staff - we didn’t have any need to speak too much to the staff but check in (and out) were quick, efficient and polite. Negatives:Rooms - as mentioned already in other reviews, they are very small. I would avoid the corner rooms (although you do get two windows). Overall these rooms aren’t worse than other New York hotels but the lack of storage exacerbates the problem (see below). Storage - there is literally none. This wouldn’t be so much of an issue if there was somewhere to store your suitcase. I have stayed in other very small rooms but they have the raised beds that allow you to store your suitcase underneath. The beds here were high enough to allow for this but they didn’t. This would be a massive improvement. This didn’t affect our enjoyment of the stay, just seems like something that could be improved.  Overall I would highly recommended the hotel.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Ideally situated, walking distance to Ground Zero, Brooklyn Bridge, Battery Park and Wall Street.Easy access to Metro system to get to Central Park etc.Friendly helpful staff would certainly stay there again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent hotel a few blocks from Ground Zero. Hotel location is very good (for us in this particular trip), staff is friendly, and most importantly, the room is clean and spacious (for NY standards).

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We got a good deal online (considering the prices in New York), the location is great, excellent value, comfortable bed...after two nights we left rather disappointed. It was a..."meh" stay.The staff at reception were ok. They were not rude, but they were not friendly either.The rooms were alright. They were not too small, but they were not spacious either. ..and so on.I think the problem is that we expected more from a hotel with the Sheraton name on it. You expect a big chain to be rather impersonal when it comes to decoration, little details, etc but, at the same time, you expect the friendlier staff, great service, bigger rooms and an overall touch of class which we definitely miss this time around.In saying that, if you get a good deal, it is worth the stay. Location, cleanliness and security make it a safe bet for a couple of nights.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for business but usually prefer midtown so I can be near theaters and restaurants I know. The area is interesting and safe to walk around. Not many tourists though you’re not far from the 911 Memorial. The front desk people were pleasant and the room was comfortable. Room service was too expensive and had extra charges added. The restaurant/bar off the lobby is pretty good and there’s a nice courtyard area outside the hotel entrance. The hotel is on a tiny street so far downtown that’s its hard to find and hard to get to.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: First of all I must say that Theresa at front desk was great at check in and went out of her way to get me a brand new yoga mat to use since she wasn’t satisfied that the ones they had were nice enough. Staff all around warm and friendly. Rooms nicely remodeled but minuscule. Very convenient to Wall Street and very lively neighborhood on a weeknight. Would come back here if I need to be in this area.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here in December of 2016. The room had 2 queen size beds, it had a great size bathroom. It was about 15 minutes from Times Square on the subway. We stayed here because everything in Times Square is so over priced!!! This location saved us money!! The subway station was just around the corner maybe a 1-2min walk. There is a Duncan donuts nearby where we would stop by for our morning coffee. Grocery stores and restaurants are all walking distance.We always felt safe even when coming back late at night from Times Square and sightseeing!!! Highly recommend!!!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Although the staff was very friendly we had some problems with the services. We were for people and daily were supplied on 3 towels only. I had to call the front desk every day for 8 days in a roll asking for an extra towel. The beds are comfortable but small to be shared. The shower was good but the daily cleaning of the shower tub was not satisfactory. I would come back because in general it is a good hotel, the location was good, and the hotel bar (specially the food) was a stand out! highlights for Enrique that works at the bar!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for one night. Easy and convenient On mobile app. Checked in and out via the mobile app. Upgraded to a corner King deluxe. Being a gold member helps. Clean and spacious. Next time I will stay here again ! No complaints
