Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I like the hotel. It feels shiny new. Nicely laid out, compact and efficient. My room was a deluxe and it was plenty big. My peek at a regular room looked OK size-wise. Bed and linens very comfortable. Well located.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights , room very small and looked out onto a concrete wall. Tiny wardrobe so couldn't unpack all clothes, no space for shoes. Didn't empty bins in room or bathroom. Forgot to refill coffee on last day so no drink. Bed very comfy but took filled the entire room!!! Air con extremely noisy. A good area to stay as Fulton subway not far. We had a fab holiday and actually prefer this area to Midtown as its not as 'touristy' but the Hotel rooms are a little on the small side.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Recently stayed 2 nights while on business trip. Room appeared to be recently renovated - modern feel. Comfortable bed (little on soft side), with lots of feather pillows (not a lot of neck support). Small, but clean bathroom. Shower only, plenty of hot water. Tall ceilings. Free coffee, tea and water in room. Desk/chair to work at. Multiple windows. Was surprised on how quiet it was at night -- is there is a background "hum" from the HVAC system that acts somewhat like a sound machine.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I like this hotel, the bed is comfortable and the room is clean. Those are the most important things to me. The tv works well and the bathroom is good too, clean and with amenities.The staff was friendly and it's in a great location. Near subways and everything you could need in close proximity.Getting a room with a view is not really necessary as all the buildings around are taller so you won't see anything.. that was a bit of a waste of my money.The only other little things are, quite a lot of airco noise from outside but you are in a big city of course.. I always travel with earplugs then it's fine.And the elevators can take a long time for such a high building with so many people.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Service was amazing, everyone was really helpfull and nice.The room was very clean and had a very confortable bed.The location is very close to the world trade center museum, wall street and subways.The hotel is also has pharmacys and supermarkets a few blocks away.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We would recommend this hotel--We had one room (one of two rooms) with issues. (Hakim)--manager--addressed the issues in a quick, professional, and courteous manner. Customer service was outstanding--needed personal items--Hakim's staff was able to get the items to me quickly. Hotel met our needs and expectations.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel prices in New York fluctuate quite a bit according to the seasons, and early Oct. happened to be one of its peaks. Even so, Four Points managed to be slightly cheaper than its competitors (at almost 300 dollars per night including tax).With that caveat, the experience wasn't all that bad; check-in/out were brisk, if a little impersonal. The room was rather small, designed for the convenience of single travellers, but somewhat redeemed by windows on two sides of the wall, giving an illusion of space. Amenities within the room were in keeping with average 2-3 star hotels (paper cups and no slippers), although the bed was surprisingly comfortable. The A/C can be quite loud at unpredictable times, a potential issue in high summer. Due to time constraints, had to order breakfast at the restaurant attached to the hotel, and was suitably disappointed with rather greasy omelette and potato wedges, but then again, the neighbourhood isn't all that well-known for good food choices anyways.So, with the caveat that one is paying for seasonal New York prices, the general experience was quite all right, and maybe that is all that one could wish for when staying in mid-range chains like Four Points.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms were clean and bigger then expected. The beds for a double room was a little smaller then a queen but can easily sleep 2 per. Walking distance to the word trade center, Brooklyn bridge, and Statue of Liberty.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for a few nights. Location was near the office. Room was tiny but it's NYC so to be expected. I had a window with no view. Shower was fine and bed was comfortable. Front desk check in was quick and courteous.Budget hotel with NYC prices so that's like $300/night.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I am shoked about how badly we where treated at this hotel! Location is great, but otherwise would not recommend this hotel. In addition, the price was not worth the services offered.We had some issues with our room and contacted the reception about it. However after changing rooms, another problem occured. The room air-conditioning/ air vent started to keep a terrible noice. We called the reception and they told us that we are imagining the noice and that they cannot help us further. So we slept the night with this loud, very disturbing noice. We complained about this further the next day and where told that the manager would be informed about this and we'd be contacted later. Later, when returning to the hotel we asked again about this and the receptionist told that no discussion had ocured and just said they cannot help us. Two weeks later we have not heard anything of the hotel...

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Positive: room clean, pretty close to metroNegative:- the hotel offers no breakfast buffet. The breakfast is in the café next to the lobby but only a la carte. Menu is limited, for example no plain sandwich with cheese, no fruit offered.- room very very small- don't like the pillowsThere is nothing special about this hotel, I just booked it because the price was low on booking.com

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Location is quiet at night, and it took a while to get to the nearest Subway. Service is budget, but the front-desk guy is just great and really helpful. Room is quite tight, but compensated by the very low price.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I'm currently staying at this hotel and I had to write this review so I will not forget how horribly rude front desk was to me. I was traveling from out of state and a late checking. Due to the construction going on, my driver was unable to drop me directly in front of the hotel. Since I couldn't see a sign or something I had to walk around for 15 minutes in the cold trying to find this place. I called their number and the guest service associate that answered was no help and basically short and rude on the phone. Anyway, I made it there and she looked at me up and down and was like "you staying here" as if people like me couldnt stay here". I was like yeah, she gave a look again and was like "you can come here". She was very rude for someone in front desk, when I asked her some question about where I could find food, she gave a Chinese food take out menu and that was it. I came downstairs and had to change my keys because they were inactivated, this time I met a gentlmean who was no better. Dont get me wrong, yeah I know it's new York and people are rude there but I thought that Sheraton would want their guests to fill at home and feel welcome. As far as the room, they very small and barely any place to move and it feels like a prison cell, but then again this might explain why the front guest acted like they did. I dont know how the rest of my stay will but my first impression of the place was not the best and will not be coming back to another Sheraton hotel.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed only for one night but have a few observations. I booked a corner queen room because I found it online for CHEAP. It was worth the approx $175 total I paid to stay in Manhattan and the bed was one of the better hotel beds I have ever slept in. However, the room just barely fits that bed. There is a very narrow desk that doesn't even have a chair because there is no room. Also no real closet - just a cabinet that would accommodate shirts but not pants or dresses. I am glad I was staying by myself - there was not room for two people in the room. Also, although the room seemed clean, the hotel itself did not. There was a discarded Wendy's soda cup on the credenza next to the elevator on my floor for my entire stay. There was also paper on the floor in the hallways. The lobby was littered with suitcases randomly scattered throughout out. Didn't inspire confidence in me that the place was keeping a careful watch on people's suitcases (I am guessing they had been dropped off for people who arrived before checkin in). Although the bed was comfy, I didn't sleep well. I have stayed across the courtyard at Gild Hall and in my sister's apartment (106 John) before and slept well. However, I could hear every noise outside at this place. In short, if you are looking for an economy stay and don't really want to be impressed, this is your place. If you looking for it to have some differentiating factor, this is not your place.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Looking for luxury not here! Small rooms, very clean comfortable, convenient to Timesquare. Friendly staff, reasonably priced for location. If you just want to sleep and run Manhattan it will suit your needs. Not full service

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was modern and clean, room could've been a bit bigger, not a lot of storage space or space to move around. The view is blocked on most floors. Nice staff members and good service. Good food at the restaurant downstairs.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed over for a night after a flight into Newark. It's sort of a typical small room nyc hotel. The bathroom was fine and clean. The tv reception wasn't good. I typically just deal with it. This time I tried to call downstairs. I emphasize tried. The phone didn't work. I gave up.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for a day only and wanted to extend for another day, unfortunately the rate just gone up compared to the deal I got for one day booking.The rooms are clean and neat, location is good, but you shouldn't rely on front desk for parking they might guide you to a more expensive option. The parking in the same block on 201 Pearl St will give you $30 for a daily rate if you provide them with Hotel stamp. The hotel front desk guided me to another parking which costs $45.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I appreciated the cleanliness and quietness of the room. The room is not spacious but one's has everything one's need and it feels cosy. Excellent king size bed.Good location though a bit difficult to find. Really have a good look at the map before strolling around out of the subway I warmly recommend this Hotel.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: It all started at check-in. After flying in from Texas, we arrived earlier than the 3:00 pm check-in time. We were told to come back at 3 and our room would be ready. Well at 4:00 pm, we were finally given a key to our room. We had 4 people in our party but we're given only 1 key. When asked the clerk said they were waiting on a key order and would have some in a few hours. The room was booked for 5 nights on Booking.com. As such,when I tried to add my Marriott Rewards at check in, I was told our stay didn't qualify because it was booked through a third party. WHAT?? That's plain ridiculous. We had ordered extra towels which were not furnished so we had to ask for them again each day.The air conditioner was broken(bad thermostat) and they said they would have engineering look at it. Well, it was never fixed and all they did was try to educate me on how HVAC systems work. We roasted for 4 days...very uncomfortable.The shower head was broken and the shower wouldn't drain. Again they were informed but failed to rectify the problem. The conditioner dispenser was refilled after we complained, but was not working so nothing would dispensed.No microwave, no fridge and lighting was less than adequate. On the plus side, free bottled water each day.You have many choices for a stay downtown, so you would think they would go an extra mile to earn your business...not in this case. Very disappointed in the property while at the same time the staff were pleasant. Be careful, a bargain may be more than a bargain!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is nicely located in the financial district of NYC, Walking distance to most sites in lower Manhattan. The rooms are nice but rather small, but who goes to the city to be in a room. My trip to this hotel would have been a great weekend except for the fact my girlfriend left her passport in the room, in one of the dresser drawers, I contacted the hotel later in the night on the day I checked out, The hotel has a lost and found extension that goes to the house keeping dept. I must have called this number 30-40 times over several days and not once was the phone answered, I left numerous messages on the answering machine and to this day never received a callback from that office. Now I checked out of the hotel on Aug 7th and was told by the front desk and a manager of the hotel that the room was thoroughly searched for this passport but to no avail. Now on August 29th I received an email telling me the hotel has found the passport in question. Great they found the passport 3 weeks later, I guess somebody new actually cleaned the room and did their job and looked for items left behind. I am assuming the person or persons who say they looked in room either lied to me or lied to their supervisors, which is a problem onto itself, but the saga continues, I contact the hotel they tell me they have the passport, I personally travel to the hotel 3 times and each time I am told that yes they have it but it is locked in the house keeping office and they cant access the safe. I am assured each time that they will notify the house keeping supervisor( Kai) and he will leave it with the front desk. This never happened until today Sept 4th I finally get the email to another manager at hotel Maurice Joyner who assures me she will have this rectified by 1pm. Thank God I finally talk to someone who tells me the truth. this manager has Kai contact me and finally he tells me the passport will be left at front desk. In retrospect had the house keeping staff done their job, My girlfriend would have had her passport the latest on Aug 8th but today is sept 4th and we had to pay several hundred dollars out of pocket to get her an emergency passport for her to be able to travel back to her home Country and 4 more days in another hotel attempting to straighten this mess out. In closing the hotel is fine as long as you dont need the staff to go out of their way to help you in anyway. The fact that I have been ignored and lied to is really a problem with me at this point. I think the hotel management needs to rectify this problem because I believe their staff actively lies to their management, until that situation is fixed I would never reccomend this particular four points to anyone. I have never had a problem before in this hotel chain but this gives me reason to rethink that.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff was amazingly friendly and accommodated and dire request for a late check-out. This was very much appreciated. The location of this hotel is very good. Many attractions nearby and a very nice experience overall! Highly recommend - ask for Michalyn and Anne at the front desk (pictured)...

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms and common areas were as good as expected: clean and comfortable. The room service was appropriate, even though we were a group of three and we had to say it in order to get coffee stuff and bottles of water for the three of us (they were serving us only for two people). However, to be fair, the staff of the front desk was not very efficient. We had several problems with the payment and they were not very friendly in those moments. In addition, they charged us more than the bill due and when they realized they had to give us money back they calculated it wrong. We had to do the math and that's when they recognized their mistake and gave back the correct amount of money. They didn't even give a proper explanation nor apologize for the inconvenience caused. They were not helpful when asked about information concerning the city or transports. That is why we think that given the quality of the hotel these details should be improved.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location near Fulton street Subway station. Wallinheimo distance from Brooklyn bridge and 9/11 memorial etc. Hotel was clean and room with oon bathroom. Two large beds. WiFi worked well and was quick enough.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: the location is one of the best in the city also for business. I was only 2 days meeting some of my clients. I had a good room , large and clean, with all modern comfort. The loby is elegant and the bar area as well . the staff was friendly

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We loved the hotel and its location in the city! Our room was clean, big and modern while the bathroom was huge. Before reaching NY we had been told hotels could be very expensive and yet provide low-quality and small rooms. This is not the case! Absolutely recommend the structure in the middle of downtown Manhattan. Wall Street and One World Trade Centre are just few minutes away and the area is 100% safe, plus being this the financial district of the city it is not as cahotic and loud as other districts on the island. The only problem we experienced was with the wi-fi (slow to connect and even when connected wouldn't always allow us to navigate) but to be honest we didn't even ask the staff for help as we had our mobile internet, so wouldn't consider this an issue. Great place to stay in NYC!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I was here with my wife and two children. The bedroom was modern and clean with easily enough space for the four of us. Check very efficient and friendly - took about a minute. A really useful aspect of the hotel for us was they were happy to look after our bags on the day of departure. Our flight wasn't until 9.30pm and with check-out at midday we could have had a problem. However, they have a system in place to look after your bags and they will also book you a taxi to the airport. Overall no problems whatsoever and highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We usually stay in midtown so wanted to see a different part of town. Location fit the bill- walked Brooklyn bridge, explored east village, went to 9/11 and one World Trade Center. Just two nights - for all the construction scaffolding in the area, the room was surprisingly quiet. AC needs card key in slot to work properly - we almost died when we walked in (weren't told this at desk). Called and they were sending up engineering -- but we looked around and discovered this in time (wondered why we got so many cardkeys !) elevator also requires a tap of card key and we liked this security measure. Room seemed clean even if small (it IS Manhattan afterall). Bathroom had dispensers for shampoo shower wash and conditioner which weren't filled. Towel refill shorted us a mat and large towel - by the time we discovered, we felt it was too late to call and wasn't major ). Tv was good, bedlinens clean and beds were comfy.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms were sufficient and clean. A/c was not sufficient. I think the units are freezing in the middle of the night. Too tired to call for repairs temp 75. Apology accepted. Room was sufficient for NYC. Bathroom spacious and clean. Elevators can be slow. Smallish lobby for the number of people coming and going. All in all I would have been fine if the a/c worked.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: the hotel is on a very small street. not easy to find if you're new to the area but you can walk from the metro to get here, it's like a five minute walk and you can use your Gps. it's safe at night and the bar wings are great..a little expensive but they are offered.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel locates at the downtown. The room is clean and safe but a bit small. Local attractions such as Trinity church, 911 Memorial, and Battery park are in walking distance. No breakfast provides in the hotel but we could find a nearby restaurant. Subway is also in walking distance.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed two nights in NYC and chose this hotel for its good position near the financial district and other local attractions.Our stay was ok, but it did not correspond to the SPG standards we were used to by other SPG hotels. The room was pretty, however the air conditioner made a terrible noise, so we had to switch it off during the night. Moreover the shower was only cleaned superficially (the corners were really dirty).The complimentary breakfast we received as SPG members was a bad joke. Two small pieces of pastery and a few slices of fruit, (probably the absolute minimum the SPG standard requires).All in all our stay was ok as we didn't really spent much time in the room. It's ideal for young couples who just want to visit NY.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Here for wedding. Whole wedding party and guests are staying here. Platt street is a bit hard to find but near Wall Street and subway access. Hotel is clean and modern but rooms are tiny. Good air conditioning in room BUT ELEVATOR AND HALLS ARE HOT. Hard to believe for the cost of rooms. Bars and restaurants are a bit pricy but acceptable. Bed is comfy. Safe in room. Did I say rooms are tiny?

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My family and I enjoyed our four nights stay at this hotel. No matter how many times you exited or enter the front doors you were greeted each time ! Exceptional customer service, very clean and good food. Couldn't find one thing that was dirty☝. Hotel was in walking distance of the Empire State Building and Time Square. Great restaurants close by. Wish the hotel had a bigger gym. My room had the best view of the Hudson River!!! I love New York and would recommend this hotel to everyone.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I've stayed at this Four Points 6 or so times since it first opened and, given it's a Four Points, I don't have any issues. As an SPG Platinum I rarely get upgraded (only time was on my first visit) but their range of rooms are going to be limited because it's a Four Points, not a Sheraton or Westin etc. The hotel is clean, the rooms are reasonable (given you're downtown), and it's actually pretty quiet. If you want to be near financial district, everything is walkable within 15 min or less. I usually take subway over but Uber's can find it too :)I've tried the attached restaurant and it's okay overall, but better than most restaurants attached to Four Points. Again, with the right expectations I think you'll be happy.Only blips are: a) closet space, b) AC has been known to be problematic sometimes (but the fixes have been quick, and c) when there's an adjoining door then the noise from bathroom can filter through too easily for one's liking if you had a heavy drinker next door. But it's NY, these things happen.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Not a great hotel. The location is not very convenient. No view. Surrounded by high rise buildings. The rooms are claustrophobic small. You feel like being suffocated. The bathroom was not well designed. There was no divider to separate the shower area from the main shower. Every time I used the shower the entire bathroom floor turns in to a mini pool. The shower had a mind of its own. It was a "push to turn on" shower and every couple of minutes it would stop and I had to push again for the water flow to resume. Taking a shower was a nightmare. Rooms are very clean and the bedding comfortable. And the coffee is just amazing.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Visited here thinking I'd get world class treatment for the price I paid. The cleanliness of the room is top notch with room services that were very impressive. But the overall staff experience was below par compared to what I got in other hotels in New York at that price range. The rooms were smaller. You'd have to walk quite a bit to get a restaurant with prices that are not skyrocketing. Although, if price is not an issue you could dine in the bar on the ground floor (excuse the staff experience and the racism). I'd say my experience was just about okay if not bad.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stay in this hotel between new year eve 2016. The hotel is very close to the financial district, wall streat, brooklyn bridge and one world observatory and quite new. When we arrive to the room in the 27 floor we have two enormous beds that I cannot climb up the bed without a stool (that was below the bedside table). The hotel offers coffee and milk in the morning and water in the bedroom. For sure I will stay again in this hotel when i come back.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The lobby was nice the elevator was ok but the hallways were dingy and warm. The room is small but it is NYC the location has many things around it but there is construction again this is NYC. What was disappointing was the lack of customer service and when I brought up an issue the response was I told him to fix it, the thing is you knew he had no idea and should have fixed it as you knew what was wrong.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The location was perfect!! But... the rooms it self were very small, there were 4 ppl in my rooms and was very congested. Another negative was that we could hear EVERYTHING from outside. It was very noisy at night.. and they also had earplugs which we were confused at first but then realised what they were for

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend and we were quite pleased with this hotel. It's a newer property, and very clean, in a safe neighborhood. The room was small, but this is Manhattan so it's to be expected. Besides, we didn't spend much time in the room itself. The hotel is a few blocks from the Fulton Street subway, and an easy walking distance to Wall Street, the 9/12 Memorial, the South Street Seaport, and the East River. The Financial District is quiet during the weekend (which we liked), but still has everything you need within a few blocks. Would definitely come back!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stay in this hotel with 3 child for 5 days.We booked a rooms with booking.com ... after our coming the receptionist says us that they havent our rooms and they must give us other rooms...the problem was that childrens have one totally small room (and we booked big room with 3 beds)...So New York city is amazing...but hotel NO...

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I thought this property was ok but could be better.The hotel is in a good location in the Financial District. It was easy to get to touristy places like Statue of Liberty or World Trade Center. The wifi worked really well (free for SPG members). The rooms are in good condition. Hotel held bags after check-out. What needs to be better: housekeeping staff. My room was covered in dust (and so was the room occupied by another party in our group). They failed to restock items when servicing the room (I left a note asking to fill the body wash dispenser and leave wash cloths -- the housekeeper threw it out but didn't do either). My room was next to the housekeeping store room on the 9th floor and the staff allowed the door to slam constantly.. at one point shaking the walls. When I checked out, staff didn't ask how my stay was.. so I didn't bring up any of this. The lobby is high traffic and needs to be cleaned more frequently. I never actually saw anyone cleaning anything in this place.. and I was there for four days.Staff could be friendlier, but maybe it's just a New York thing.Overall, the stay was fine but nothing special. Given the options in New York, I would stay somewhere else next time.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed in this hotel during a recent trip to New York and I must tell you that it is centrally located in the heart of Financial District and very close to major attractions. Statue of Liberty, World Trade Center Memorial, New York Stock Exchange etc. are within 10 minutes of walk from this place.Hotel is very neat and clean but rooms are little small. Also, bathroom is too small. Other than date rest all is fine and as per Sheraton standard. I didn't try food in the hotel so unable to comment on that.Overall recommend this hotel if you want to stay in the Financial District and are ok with a little small room (specially bathroom)!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Love the bed, bedding and plush pillows! Nice clean rooms, excellent service, great location! Cool rooftop garden bar and nice little restaurant on the floor. Nearby juice n salad bar, 24hr convenience store, bars and walking distance to the 9/11 Memorial. We left our suitcases in the lobby for 5hrs after checkout as we walked around waiting for our late flight. Will definitely be back when in NY!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is located in Downtown, few minutes walk from Wall Street & FDR drive. You can pretty much walk the entire NY downtown area, visit Ground Zero, One WTC, Battery Park, take the ferry to Lady Liberty by walking from this hotel. Midtown is only a few train stops away... There's good shopping & food all around the hotel.The rooms are nice, well equipped, and the hotel staff are friendly & helpful. Recommended

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Check in: The lobby is currently undergoing a little renovation (painting), however is clean and tidy and has tea and coffee facilities, the staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms: We are a bit undecided on how to rate the rooms. They were clean and tidy, we had a couple of issues with housecleaning, ie. we stripped the bed to get new sheets and the sheets we took off the bed were put back on the bed and towels that had been used were folded and put on the racks. The rooms would be better if a small fridge for cold drinks would be supplied. Food: we are unable to comment as we ate out.Check out: the elevators are in keen demand in the morning so allow extra time.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My wife and I stayed in three separate hotels during our most recent stay in NYC. This was our least favorite of them all. The room was very small, in that I don't know how it should accommodate more than one person. We had reserved and expected a king bed, yet when we checked in, we were given one with a queen instead. The walls were thin so we heard everything in the neighboring room. All in all, we wouldn't return to this hotel and probably wouldn't have stayed there the first time knowing what we now do, particularly when there were other nearby hotels providing better value for similar prices.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was nothing special a fairly standard hotel room. The bed was very comfy and I slept well. The main problem I had was the hot water. Firstly there was no cold water coming out of the tap - ever! I didn't like brushing my teeth in hot water. Secondly the water got so hot it was impossible to get under the shower. It was actually dangerous. I was there during the week when the temperature outside was up to 93 degrees and very humid so a cool shower would have been very welcome. I told the staff and they didn't seem surprised and nothing was done for the time I was there.The second thing that was a problem was that the lights around the tv unit wouldn't turn off if you had the key card in the holder by the door because the switch didn't work. I told the staff who said they would get it looked at but again nothing was done. I just had to take the card out of the holder. Overall the hotel was just about OK. The location was perfect for the reason I was there but I wouldn't choose to stay there again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Recently stayed here for 4 nights in May and found the hotel to be comfortable and quiet when compared with the constant bustle of midtown Manhattan. The hotel is well served by the metro lines, making it easy to get to almost anywhere in New York and Times Square is only around 20 minutes away. The room was a good size especially compared with others that we looked at online and has free wifi. There are also plenty of choices for breakfast, lunch and dinner within a short walk of the hotel. The only real negative was the cleanliness of he room, whilst not bad enough to be an issue, the bedside table needed dusting when we arrived and did not get done during our stay, on one day as well, the room did not get made up. However these weren't big enough problems to make it a bad stay or something that the hotel should be avoided for - had we said anything then I'm sure it would be have been sorted for us as the staff were all helpful.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I knew I had made a mistake booking this hotel when I walked into the lobby to check in. It is cheap and out of date. The room was the smallest I have ever stayed in and there was no view. The room had been updated but had no style. If all you want is a place to sleep this place is fine but this is NYC where there are so many amazing, fun hotels.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is not up to par for a Sheraton property. The room was very small, clean(ish) but the bed was ridiculously high (the hotel provides wobbly leather footstools for guess who aren't tall enough to climb onto the bed/anyone under 5'7"). There was no in-room fridge or even mini-bar. Ice is available only on the 2nd floor of the hotel or by calling guest services (we were on the 23rd floor). The "green" option for housekeeping actually means NO housekeeping whatsoever - they don't refresh coffee or even empty the trash. We requested the "green" option the first night & when we asked about trash removal were told that housekeeping won't enter the room if the "green" sign is on the door. However, it was OBVIOUS that someone had been in the room - lights were left on and a piece of cardboard jammed into the wall socket to keep the lights on. When we informed the front desk, they had no response - just looked embarrassed. There was no guide to the local area (or map available at the front desk) & no guide to the channels on the TV in-room or on request. The front desk could not reserve a table at the in-hotel restaurant but instead put us through to the restaurant where it took forever to get an answer and then we were disconnected TWICE. The food in-room and at the in-hotel restaurant is mediocre and over-priced. There are no palatable vegetarian and no vegan options. There are few decent restaurants in immediate walking distance unless you like "family fare" Italian. When asked the best way for my 80+ mother to get from the hotel to the station, the clueless woman at the front desk suggested taking "the train" although 80+ should've been a clue and trains weren't running to the stop near the hotel. Unlike every other hotel in Manhattan, the front desk couldn't even suggest a car service but instead suggested she walk several blocks to a "taxi line" (there isn't one nearby). Overall, I was embarrassed that what I thought would be a decent place for my mother to stay while in town turned out to be overpriced, in an awkward location (not hear any trains), and with lousy guest services. Sheraton should be ashamed to include this hotel under its brand.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Hotel is in a perfect location where you could walk to Battery Park for the Statue of Liberty or walk to the 9/11 museum and the subway was a 5 min walk away to take you anywhere in Manhattan.Hotel staff was very nice and even though the room was very small, it was very clean and inviting and seemed to be new! Never ate at the restaurant in the hotel, but the menu looked good. As this hotel in is the financial district, it was very busy outside but the nights were great because the streets are not as busy and with tons of restaurants nearby.I would definitely would recommend this property if you are visiting manhattan because the location is great especially if you don't want to stay in Times Square

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I am a platinum SPG member, so I did get upgraded to a corner suite. I had a separate living room and bedroom, so space was definitely not an issue! The staff was pleasantly welcoming. They brought as many water bottles as I wanted throughout my entire stay. There is a fabulous restaurant to go to for brunch connected to the hotel. We ended up going there as a last minute decision, and so glad we went.The hotel is walking distance to the famous charging bull and the new fearless girl statue. There is a convenient store around the corner, as well as a Walgreens. They have food trucks in the neighborhood and other restaurants for all food types. I am giving this hotel 4 stars because the bathroom was just simply too small for me. It was hard to get ready when there wasn't much space to put things. The shower was nice though!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Clean rooms, fast service. Located downtown manhattan close to financial district. If you have meetings in Wall Street definitely that's a spot to pick. Room service is great. Check it out. It's totally worth it.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My daughters and I stayed here during the Easter Holiday 2017. We enjoyed the location as it was close to the subway station and the 911 Memorial. We also liked that it wasn't in the middle of everything. It was kind of a respite after a long day amongst the crowded city. As a matter of fact, the restaurant in the hotel was fantastic. The service was impeccable and the ambiance was great. The customer service in the hotel was great as well. When it rained, they provided an umbrella for us to use for the day.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We had a room for 4 persons. Room was clean. We had new tea bag, coffee and 2 bottles of water every day. The hotel has very good position, near to Brooklyn bridge, Wall street, World trade center ect. on foot. I recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: sweet hotel with a sweeter staff. rooms are decent, beds are super comfy, and depending on the floor views can be lovely. restaurant next door has great menu, Ketch, and staff can provide discount cards to offset costs.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed 7 days in New York. Four points by Sheraton located at 40th street near Bus station and near Time Square . Our first time in the city. The place is near everything from subway to restaurants and shop. Nice location with basic breakfast and helpful staff. Will come back again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I thought this was a great place to stay in NYC at this price point. The room is very small of course but very comfortable and nicely furnished for one person. The lobby was pleasant and modern with nice touches like free coffee and the staff were friendly. The location was fine - the area doesn't offer a huge amount but is very convenient to public transportation.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed for 3 days in this hotel. It is very clean, rooms are comfortable, and the hotel staff very helpful and friendly, they would go out of their way to help with our lost luggage. The location is excellent within walking distance to all Downtown attractions and shopping, while still in a quiet back street. Lots of places to eat in the area and very safe.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights in March. Located very near Fulton Street Subway station, I found this hotel a great choice to stay in terms of pricing, location, convenience to reach some of the popular tourist spots and with a good collection of eateries. This was my first trip to New York and hence I can't compare this with another hotel or location.Pricing: For under 300 $, this was a nice deal. No complimentary breakfast with the plan I selected. Rooms near midtown around Times Square were far more expensive.Location: If I were to stay around Penns station, it would have felt like a journey downtown to the Brooklyn bridge, Wall Street and Staten Island/Statue of Liberty. However, with these locations at a walking distance and Fulton st. subway just a few steps away, I feel staying here and taking a subway to go to midtown would be a better way to ensure that you cover both areas well. You can roam around Times Square and Madison Garden till late night and get back using the A train. If it isn't raining, you can walk up to Brooklyn bridge and also to the Staten Island ferry. Take a subway or a bus to Midtown and you can get down right next to Times Square (Subway train A).Another advantage with Fulton street subway station is that you get a direct train (A) from Howard Station next to JFK. You would need to go till Jamaica and change over if you were to go to Penns. I don't know - felt Howard was easy given that it's attached to JFK.Cabs in NY are expensive! I paid 65$ on my way back to the airport as I had some heavy bags to carry. My trip was impacted due to continuous rain and I didn't have the mood to carry my luggage till the subway station.There are plenty of cycle rental shops nearby - another great way to roam around the city.Shopping: If you are in to discount shopping, try Lot Less at 95 Fulton Street. There is a Real Deal dollar N discount at 59 John St. - at a stone's throw from the hotel.Eateries: You will find all cuisines in plenty. Ketch Brewhouse attached to the hotel was nice too, a bit on the pricier side. There is a McD and another hot dog place (can't recollect the name) opposite to Lot-Less at Fulton street that are open 24 hours. So, if you are in to walking around in the night or return to the hotel really late, there is something open to grab a bite.Rooms: Fairly spacious, bathroom was fine with a tiny bathtub. Nothing much to complain there. Worth the price indeed. Folks at the front desk were very helpful with useful tips to go around.One thing I really loved was USB charging ports in the room - in plenty. It was so easy to charge cellphone and other USB chargeable devices. Being from India, taking out a universal adapter and hooking it up was a bit of a planned effort. Presence of USB chargers in the room helped a lot.Room has standard accessories like a coffee machine and iron box.I would like to come back and spend like 5 nights to see New York as my first trip was marred by rain. I did what I could in terms of shopping and walking around, but another week of vacation is due. I'd prefer the same hotel.Note: You will find some hotels near Long Island that are cheaper than the downtown four points. Though in the map it looks like it's just 5 miles, I felt it is not a place where you would want to walk in the middle of the night. Going to midtown/downtown and returning will require some planning if you were to choose Long Island.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We travel a lot and it is very rare to find a hotel this good for an average price. We where more than 15 people, most of them kids, and we have an amazing stay. The hotel staff was really helpful, especially when arriving and leaving, arranging cabs for us and helping us with all our luggage. The location is amazing, walking distance from many downtown sites and close to subway stations.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Pros : • location but still it was very hard even for taxi driver to find this place because hotel is located somewhere in the corner of the street . • easily accessible to Subway • walkable to ground zero and statue of liberty ferry Cons : • Rooms were too small for the price they charge . There is hardly no space to walk in the room , only suitable for 2 people even a small kid cannot be accompanied • don't choose corner king room if travelling with kids• never try their breakfast unless it is part of your booking as don't have any buffet spread though • too noisy since some construction is happening next to the hotel and don't expect any view from the rooms

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I was in NYC for a business trip, and I selected this hotel as it was part of the SPG network. I extended my stay for a few days, but since this hotel was so inexpensive, I stayed here (even though the location is not as desirable as other parts of Manhattan) due to the low cost.The service is great, and proximity to the Stock Exchange/financial district is nice. It's not as close to other things in Manhattan, but I knew that going into it. The rooms were large and well appointed. I had room service one or two nights, and that was well appointed. We were in a handicap accessible bathroom due to check-in time, and as a result we had a handicap shower. This did become my nemesis on the trip because the water would never stay on. I called down once or twice to have them show me how to do it properly, and I could still never figure it out. I assume it was due to the handicap features, so most rooms are probably not like that. Overall, nice, convenient location for business, great value in NYC, clean, well appointed rooms and part of the SPG family.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Great location.Efficient checkin staff.However, there were 4 of us and when arriving in our room their was no mattress or linen for the bed sofa. We had to call guest services for the first time to get these. It took 15 minutes for the line to arrive.On our first day in NYC when showering it became apparent that our shower had no shampoo, conditioner or shower gel. We had to ring guest services for the second time to fill these to allow the rest of the family to shower.On our second day our room wasn't made up. On our third day our room was made up but they didn't leave an extra toilet roll so again we had to ring guest services for the third time to get this item. It didn't arrive for 20 minutes so we called guest services for the fourth time, eventually one of the reception staff came with a toilet roll.On our last day our air conditioning unit went in to overdrive and was making a terrible noise so we had to turn it off.Overall, this hotel didn't ruin our trip to NYC but I expect better of this brand. Won't be staying here again when we return to NYC in the future!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: stayed in room 703.Didn't have no fridge,no safe.The bathroom was out of shampoo. we had to call for a re-fill at 11 pm.i think they need a spot check manager for every room.The food at there kitchen was high not forgetting they re-warmed our fry's. they never made them fresh..and we ended paying $23 dollars for that. but over roll the sleep quality was top notch. would go back most deff.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My girlfriend and I stayed here on our trip to New York! It was just wonderful! The staff was very helpful and very nice! The hotel has a great location not from wall street and the subway! The room was very nice and the bed was very comfy. The only down thing is so breakfast with the room but there are plenty places to eat at near by! I would stay at this hotel again!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This Hotel is in a great location. The hotel rooms were small, however it is a pretty good rate and we didn't spend much more than sleeping time in the hotel. The facilities are fairly basic - standard coffee/tea in room. Nice touch a few bottles of free water every time they made up the room was welcome on return from a busy NYC day.We had a room with two double beds, it had a big TV and small bathroom. Free wifi was good enough for family use with multiple devices.There is free tea and coffee in the lobby in the morning only.The staff were courteous and pleasant and were always helpful when asked. This is a small, neat & tidy hotel.The location is great. People say the financial district doesn't have many attractions however Wall Street, the federal hall & stock exchange, World Trade Center, river boat tours & south warf/statue of liberty are all a short walk from here...plus access to all the north/south subway lines. We found it much better than previous stay in mid town.Ridesharing (via app) $90 to Newark for 5 seater (SUV)

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for 5 nights in March when on a business trip. The service is good. I ordered room service twice and was quite happy with the meals. The rooms are decent sized for downtown Manhattan and have all the basic amenities that one needs. The bed was comfortable. My only grouse with the place is that I opted for the Green Choice on 3 of the stay over nights but got rewarded for only one night. Not cool FPBS!
