hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Booked this place on a short-notice business trip for $209 a night. That's obviously a very good rate for anywhere in New York in March, but when you stay here, it's pretty easy to understand why the rate is that low.First, it's a pretty basic hotel. That's fine by me - I just need a bed, a shower, a decent desk and WiFi - but anyone wanting luxury should look elsewhere. But the second reason for the good rates is that there is a construction site right next to the hotel that seems to get noisier at night.Seriously, I have never stayed in a noisier hotel room in my whole life. It was astonishingly loud, and on the first night in particular, seemed to intensify at 3am. It takes a lot to wake me once I am asleep, but this place managed it.Obviously this is no fault of the hotel as such (although better double-glazing might have kept the noise down a bit) but I would be far happier to stay here again once the building next door is complete.By the way, I was on the 7th floor, more or less directly above the construction site. It might be possible to escape the noise by requesting a room on a (much) higher floor.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Room was nice.quiet and clean with excellent amenities.Just perfect for our stay.The staff where awesome,friendly and very helpful.The location is just perfect very close to transportation,restaurants.and great attractions.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We have stayed four nights here at this modern and very comfy hotel nestled close and to the WTC. The receptionist when we arrived changed our room as they noted our queen room would be a little small for our four night stay and upgraded us to a double queen room with closet on the 27th floor. Note some smaller rooms don't have closets! The staff are all very friendly, there is a well equipped small gym in the lower level which each time we went was empty and check out is a useful 12:00 which is later than some hotels require. There are some good local restaurants nearby and Fulton Street subway is right around the corner with express trains to Penn State and the West side of uptown and also trains running uptown East. Downtown and you head into Brooklyn. I would recommend this hotel for price comfort and location. Thanks Sheraton for a great stay.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here 4 my bday wkend ! Very reasonable pricing 4 NYC and location (FND) newly renovated! Sml room but dats NYC 4 u ! Rm key controlled elevators ! New restaurant! We liked it a lot ! CLEAN +

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I was staying last week at the hotel on the 28th floor and my ride on the elevator was a terrible experience! I was going down and suddenly the elevator started dropping down faster than usual and started making sound. Then it finally got stuck somewhere near 5th floor and the elevator kept on bouncing for a while and I was stuck there for half an hour in the middle of the night between 12:30 AM to 1 AM. Anyone can get a phobia by such experience. I was even worried to let my family know about situation who were sleeping in the room to make them worry at this time of the night so I asked the staff not to inform them. It is my worst experience.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Exactly what I expected. I stay 100+ nights in hotels. This was for a NYC weekend. Easy to get to, parking nearby (use a spothero or the like). Only had a drink at the restaurant, no food. Rooms were normal sized for NYC standards, service was good. Easy access to Brooklyn too which is a big plus for us.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Absolutely terrible hotel. As a Platinum customer who travels often, I was discriminated by Elizabeth and Giovanni who worked and checked me in at around 7am on Friday 2/24. First, Giovanni honored my early check-in request which I though was nice, but then he did not tell me that I did not get the room that I wanted which was a larger room request. I found it after the fact. I went downstairs to rectify the issue and the answer was no. I understood it was early but being rude and unwelcoming with sarcastic attitude, especially from his colleague named Elizabeth, is very inappropriate. She even said something like, "oh do you need anyone to help you with your luggage", not in a very genuine way but in a way that is meant to irritate me. That attitude deserves being disciplined and as a professional I am appalled that you allow such behavior to exist in your property. I am filing a police report officially for discrimination and mistreatment because they took the opportunity to discriminate and guess what they did it successfully.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Overall, great hospitality from beginning to end, staff very accommodating and professional. My room was spectacular with an amazing view just the way I imagined it would be. This hotel is walking distance from South Street Seaport, The pier where you take the water taxis and ferry's, twin towers memorial, battery park, the list keeps going. Restaurants and eatery's in every corner, in a nutshell this Hotel is in the right location, always something to do, you will not be bored.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was small, however everything seemed to be spaced perfectly to make you feel comfortable. My favorite component to this hotel was their bathrooms. They were much nicer than a lot of the hotels in the surrounding area,

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent service and room, I'd definitely stay again. Located in the heart of Wall Street, close to transportation, and many attractions. Parking is not bad but can be pricey. Hotel is family friendly.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Our experience in this hotel was awful. It ruined most of part of holidays when we were visiting NYC. Our belongings disappear from our room (doesn't matter the value or content), but they disappear, thats a fact. We spoke with more than 3 to 5 receptionist in order to help us, but, it was like Ping Pong all the time. We told them the value of belongings which were missing and then they made discounts over some nights, anyways, they do not care the concept of being friendly and treat well their customers, and we need to follow up with them for the result, not opposite. They really don't care. The management never called us, never apologiezed,, for them the value of the belongings was only matter of money and making the discount, like solving a problem without giving any kind a humanity and treatment.Honestly, do not go for this Hotel, they will only play with you, if your belongings disappear, believe me they won't care, only if you pressurise them.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: As hectic as New York as, the best part is being able to have a quiet comfortable room to lay your head in. The sizes of the room are comfortable, especially for a New York hotel. We had an issue when we first arrived but it was fixed immediately and were able to switch rooms I believe was arranged by the manager, which was amazing !!! We also left our shoes in the old room and were taken directly to where housekeeping would of taken them. Having one on one like that made us feel like they really cared. The rooms are so clean. I always do a bed and bathroom check wherever I stay. Every part of our room was spotless and stain free! The employees were professional and kind. They seemed to always be concerned with making your stay as pleasurable as possible. I highly recommend this hotel, the location is great. There is plenty of food, shopping, and tourist attractions around!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We had a pleasant 2 night weekend stay. Rooms are small but well furnished with comfortable beds. Centrally located in NYC FiDi with dozens of great dining options close by. Front desk staff were very friendly and it was a great value for the money (though the prices go up on weekdays). Overall, a great option if you are a business traveler or a tourist who want to explore Manhattan and Brooklyn.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I enjoyed this hotel very much simply because the staff were excellent and the bed was amazing! We arrived in good time and it was an easy check in after a long flight. Straight into the room to get changed and the room was great! The downstairs bar is excellent with many offers and a good selection of beers/ales. I would love to stay again next time.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Good news first: Beds were very comfortable. Nice bed linens, room was clean, elevators worked and came frequently, security seemed good, facility seemed quiet and clean and up-to-date overall. For us, the location was perfect. It's close to the Seaport area in the Financial District. Medium news: Your previous experience with hotels in large cities (NYC, London, Rome, etc) will determine your feeling about the size of these hotel rooms. There is just enough space for the beds and a small pathway to navigate around them. This is not a fault of the hotel; just know that if you are paying less-than-exorbitant rates in NYC, your room will be tight.Not-so-good:Room wasn't ready when we arrived after 6pm. We had to return after 8pm. Desk staff very friendly but powerless to solve this problem, which arose due to cleaning staff shortage. But while standing at the front desk for A Very Long Time, I had the opportunity to notice all kinds of misplaced items in full sight behind the desk: food wrappers, overflowing trash, half-eaten dinners of staff members, random stuff (folders, purse) placed here and there. It was very unprofessional. I hate to complain about free coffee, but the coffee carafes in the lobby were empty both mornings. It seems there were not enough staff members to take care of all the work of the hotel.I would stay here again if the price beat that of nearby competitors. Rooms are decidedly nicer than those at the Holiday Inn Express Wall Street (which is actually on Water Street) around the corner. But that hotel includes breakfast, while the Four Points Sheraton does not.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed 4 nights found it to be good value. We were upgraded after our shower would not work and given a comp breakfast which was nice. Rooms as you would expect no surprises. Staff helpful. Short walk to the subway for exploring NYC.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We asked for an additional comforter and some sheets at around 10 p.m. the staff then rudely advised me that there should only be two people per room when they put us four people in one room. Instead of being considerate and just bringing me an extra comforter so my son could sleep comfortably on the floor the staff preferred to be rude and give me push back instead of helping me. I do not recommend staying here, and am very disappointed as I use the Sheraton chain quite often. Perhaps I'll be looking for other options where I'll be treated with care and compassion.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My family traveled to NYC for a 2 night stay. We are a family of 4. The hotel is perfect for a NYC trip. We loved that we were not in the middle of midtown. This hotel is about a 10 minutes walk to the 911 memorial and museum. The federal reserve building is a block away. It was so easy to take the train anywhere we wanted to go. We were able to get to all the NYC tourist stops. We arrived at the hotel around 11. We knew that a room wouldn't be ready however we were okay with that. The front desk staff tagged our luggage and we were able to enjoy the city for the day. They secured it to a back room. Once we returned later at night our check in process was smooth. There was a bar/restaurant attached to,the hotel however we did not take advantage of it. Starbucks and a dinner were a block away for breakfast. We were always put in the city for lunch and dinner. Beds were soft, bathroom was small but up to date. Room had 2 double beds. Average space for a NYC hotel. But we were only there to change and sleep. Lobby was nice. I liked that in order for the elevator to work you needed your room key. We will definitely try and book this hotel again on our future NYC trip.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Let me start by saying we travel a lot and have stayed in many different hotels around the world. I have also extensive experience in the hotel industry as a manager so will always look at the situation regarding hotel-stays from 2 different points. I will definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone, especially not families. Most staff is very unhelpful and unfriendly service from most of the staff, like Lauren and Leatichia at Front desk, and Adriaan in Restaurant. Staff on Front desk really not helpful at all- except Elizabeth, Michael and Alex. Rooms really small-basically just enough room to walk around bed. Hotel has 29 floors and around 10 rooms on every level, all allocated around the elevator area. Elevator from floor 20 and upwards really noisy, and if you are located at front of hotel also very noisy with music playing from 5pm from speakers at Entrance of hotel. (apparently to lure people into the hotel, they don't seem to care about the guest already paying to stay at the hotel.) Water pressure comes and goes, and A/C in one of our rooms needed resetting several times by an electrician. Because it stopped working every few hours. We had to move rooms 3 times, and the front of house staff not very accommodating at all. We basically had to beg for a room move every time. Leatichia on the front desk actually hanged-up on me when I called to speak to a manager (which is truly unbelievable how they treat their guests) It seems like this hotel mainly caters for functions, as they definitely do not care about families or individual guests. Unfortunately we pre-paid our stay (4 nights) so could not leave without having to loose all the money we've pre-paid. On the 3rd morning it was snowing and we thought to try out the hotel's restaurant for breakfast. We were served 2 juices for our children (3 and 6y) and 2 coffees without cream for the coffee.One of the staff members in the restaurant- Adriaan, came past and we asked him for cream, he told us to wait. then 20 minutes later (since the moment we sat down) I went to the service area where 3 staff members were all gathering. I asked for cream, and was told they are really busy. I told the server that the restaurant only had 5 tables and that there are 4 servers, so they can't be too busy. I was told by one of the servers that they are because they they are serving room service as well. 5 minutes later we just left, and had a very nice breakfast at the Blue spoon cafe on the corner. I constantly tried to speak to the General manager regarding our stay, during our stay.. but was every time told by the Front office staff, that he was not available. Mr. Cheung the General manager finally called me back at 4pm the day after we've checked out and didn't believe a word about our experience at his hotel. Not helpful at all!! I basically just wasted my time and money to try and tell him about our experience (for him to try and make it right or at least appologize ) This is the first General manager who didn't appologize, just blundly refused to help. Honestly once this hotel has your money, they do not care at all. The more functions/ groups they can get in and make some noise by playing loud music, the happier they are. If you are a family or individual, please get yourself a nice hotel where the staff care and your basic needs are met. Where you actually feel like a guest. This trip was arranged to visit a very sick Cancer patient in Memorial Sloan Kettering hospital in NY, and the first visit to NY for our children. The staff at this hotel could not make our visit any worse.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is squeezed into downtown Manhattan so one would expect to feel claustrophobic. During our stay the hotel hosted outside parties, so the elevator either never arrived or arrived fully loaded. Also elevators were not working periodically. Also during the parties, room service was not available. But the price is good for NYC. And the staff was very friendly and helpful, just very busy. Beds are very comfortable and sound between rooms is very good. Rooms are clean.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Its always hard to find a decent and affordable hotel in Manhattan but I think I have found my place. Rooms are typical Manhattan size but use of space is efficient and I was comfortable. Big bathroom with large shower that had plenty of pressure and heat. Room temp was fine although it was cold outside. TV worked fine and it had some HB and Showtime. Wifi worked fine. Coffee maker in room with coffee and tea, free bottle of water daily. Bed as very plush and comfortable. The location is excellent about a 5 minute walk to the Fulton Ave Station, although the Wall Street Station is a little easier (not as busy) if you can get by with access only to the 2 and 3 Lines. Small restaurants and coffee shops abound in the area as do fast food and donut shops. About a 10 minute walk at most to WTC Memorial and new Westfield OccuIus Shopping Center. Did not eat at the hotel restaurant and you get 15% discount. The fitness center looked brand new and barely used but it definitely is adequate for a quick workout. I found the staff pleasant and helpful, professional. Three elevators were quick and efficient. More of a business hotel, don't expect a resort or grand hotel setting with large public spaces and services.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is located very close to the financial district but that's not all. There are local eateries if you want a taste of NY and a short 5 minute walk to the OCULUS shopping center. But before you get there you run into "EATALY" which is a great place to go for your Italian fare but it is pretty pricey but worth a "LOOK SEE". 5 more minutes walk and you are at Battery Park, Statue of Liberty, Wall St and more. The subway is nearby to get you uptown in 20 min where you can go to Times Sq, Bryant Park, Central Park, and Broadway. The best part of the Four Points...it is affordable in a very expensive City. The staff was exceptional and will make you feel like you are there only guest. Enjoy your stay.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The service from the staff was awesome. We were all new to NYC and had a lot of questions in regards to the city and public transit. They were all willing to answer our questions. We also arrived early and they helped to accommodate us as best they could. The only downfall that we encountered was how small the room was. The bathroom was also small. All in all, good stay!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at the hotel for business travel on a few occasions. The service at the hotel is very good - check in and out is quick and pleasant. The hotel is pretty new so that is a plus as well, but the average room is so tiny it's like staying in a shoebox. I wouldn't have been comfortable staying for more than 1 night.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The was a once in a lifetime trip for my daughters 18th birthday. The front desk could not have been nicer Michael was so helpful and answered all of my phone calls before arrival as well as getting us in early to start the birthday celebration. The check in process was smooth and they offered us all of the information and maps we needed to explore the city. The front desk was busy but I never felt rushed. The room was perfect for the two of us. Very clean and the beds are so incredibly comfortable. The entire staff was so very accommodating and we will be returning again soon. Highly recommend this property. A great Value and close to the Subway or a short cab ride into the city.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Lauren went above and beyond any service I have ever received anywhere. I am already a loyal SPG fan and people you have, like Lauren, providing such amazing customer service make it easy for me promote your properties to friends and family. The room was perfect. I'm not expecting a palatial resort suite in the heart of downtown, but this did not feel cramped or closed-in. I was able to walk to Wall St, see the Bull on Broadway, and then over the St Peters and the financial area. Extremely easy access to anything, with some great places to eat.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We are loyal starwood customers (my husband is platinum) and when we checked it we were across from the cleaning closet. After 2 hours in the room, realized it would likely be accessed early in the morning to do their job, but also wake us up. I called down to the front desk and spoke to Lauren. She was so polite, courteous and understanding. After only a few minutes she was able to move our room. Her organization and people skills were wonderful. This hotel is lucky to have her onboard.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed for an overnight with wife and two children (11 & 8 years old) . The room is very small and similar to a European size hotel room.It was very clean though the blind was broken. The bathroom was much larger than expected. No place to really place luggage .The room is fine for two people and it be ok for a night or two max, after that you may become Stir Crazy. Walking distance Financial District ,Battery Park , Freedom Tower and South Street.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stay at many hotels, and this is by far the SMALLEST room I have ever been in, even in Europe. I booked a room with 2 beds, as I was sharing the room with a friend. Imagine my surprise when I checked in on Friday to be told they were oversold and they only had a king..... How is this my problem exactly?! Not only did I prepay through their brand website, apparently booking room types isn't important to them, as I received no apology or discount for their overbooking error. The room is tiny. Like walk sideways between bed and desk, tiny. Impossible to share with 2 people comfortably. There was hair in the shower upon checkin, and no bath mat to catch the water. The staff are the most impersonal and seem like they genuinely can care less about the customer experience. I work in the industry, and I would hope that if a guest had the experience I did, that a manager would at least BE PRESENT to address things with me. I will not recommend this hotel to anyone, it is not the worst, but with so many options in NYC, this is bottom of list. The only plus side is a Starbucks around the corner.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Bed was great very comfortable. room was always spotless after service. pretty good location. attached to a sub-par restaurant. they have pretty good coffee nice and hot in the lobby each morning. I did find that check out seemed to take a bit longer than it should.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I never do reviews but I feel a responsibility here.Conceivably this was the worst hotel Ive ever stayed at in my life. Ever.I arrived at 1130 pm on Tuesday night. When I arrived I unpacked for my 4 night stay. I noticed the room was hot and the air conditioning was not working. After they tried to fix it, it was deemed broken. I was forced to pack back up, move and unpack again. Now its 1 am. The new room was smaller, with a desk my laptop barely fit on, the phone next to the bed was "gone". The sink was still wet which made me uneasy. Next DayI went to work but before I did, I stopped by the front desk to tell them about the night before and the fiasco. The managers response "Uh Huh". And he walked off.I came back that night and got trapped in the elevator with 6 people. All the buttons on the elevator stopped working. People in the elevator hysterical. I called the front desk and the response "Uh Huh".I was waiting for the next shoe to drop.Next DayI came back from work and the bed had been made but nothing else touched. There was crumbs on the desk next to my lap top. The bathroom had tooth paste in the sink.Next DayIt became necessary to turn on the heat. Predictably the thermostat was broken in the second room. . After a few trips up by maintenance (who inferred that this was the norm) , they told me to turn it up to 80 and it would be 73 degrees.The general manager sent me an email - this was the customer service I received from all of this headache. An email.I then emailed Sheraton and got an automated email from them.Still nothing.After the inconvenience suffered and $1200 spent, I would have hoped that there would have been some form of kind thought, show of concern, by the management or Sheraton except for an email. Its such a poor showing.The employees are overwhelmed, not trained properly, and the facilities are not up to snuff. They have NO customer service skills.Ive seen this before at Sheraton this year. Truthfully I feel violated by the entire experience.Stay away from this hotel and stay away from Sheraton.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Great hotel in the heart of the financial district. Close to subway and about a 20 minute subway ride to time square. Brooklyn bridge, Chinatown and Manhattan bridge are close distance. Clean rooms with cozy beds!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We had a great week-end in NYC and this hotel provided the best value for comfort and location. We had a nice room, king bed, clean and comfortable. The front desk staff were generally pleasant and helpful, especially Alexander, who was always glad to help with suggestions. Also, they were very accommodating with our check in and check out needs. We took advantage of this hotel's location and visited the WTC memorial, South Street Seaport, Brooklyn Bridge. The rest of the city was easily covered with Uber.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: They could have easily got a 5 points review since:Our room (2 double beds) was spacious for NYC standartsElevator response time was decent for city hotelswifi was ok, even though it was limited for high trafficit was cleanfront desk staff were generally helpfullHigh floor room (28th floor) meant nice city view and almost no city noisebut:air conditioner was so noisy we gave up on using it (we visited during spring so it wasn't critical, but it's hard to imagine a summer night without air-con) the reading lights near the bed didn't work - both of them..bathroom door woudln't close properley - and made noise when you tried to close it. - regarding the last 2 issuesI asked the front desk to take care of it twice,both times we were told it would be dealt with right away, but it really wasn't..

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I like staying in Sheraton hotels because I love their comfy beds and the fact the hotels are clean. The staff was kind, saying hello and goodbye. The room was clean and the bed was comfy, the tv has a lot of channels.Unfortunately the airco machines outside make a lot of noise, both of the hotel and the blower or the restaurant. I might be a bit sensitive as I've just moved back home because of issues with this in my city but they were extremely loud. I hate that under tone noise, like when you're in a bar and you can actually feel the music.. It kept ringing in my head, while I had ear plugs in!So be aware if you stay at the lower floors (I was at floor 8 pretty close to those machines)Another thing is the elevators, they only have 3 for about 30 floors. When I left I had to catch a train and I had to wait 10 min!! On the elevator... (You can't use the stairs or obviously I would have)I won't be staying at this particular Sheraton again simply because I can't sleep well.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Negative: We booked a room for three persons, but in the first night the Hotel couldn't provide the room that we booked, they explained it with an incredible reason - toilet is leaking (beleive it, or not...). The fact is that we got two single rooms, and we had to move to another room in the next day. This very-very small room, was unsutiable for three adults, beds were exactly the same than in the single room (not enough for two persons), and there was no space for sitting and leave our luggages anywhere. We complained in the reception, and asked for bigger room, but they refused this question with a rude explanation. So we had to leave the hotel, and moved to Hilton Midtown which was an excellent choice.Breakfast is expensive, and the location suits to for just business travellers, for leisure it's too far from the main attractions of NY. WTC, Ground Zero, Statue of Liberty is close, but anything other is farPositive: Relatively helpful staff, good location, if you want to stay in the financial district. Great roof teracce.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Have stayed here for almost 3 weeks, new hotel but had issues. 1st week I found a mouse in my room. Staff changed the room and I have been moved from King size bedroom to two single beds, next day Manager sent an apology mail. Next when I booked city view room, I got a room with just wall facing room. Next the bedsheets were also little dirty. Have opted for this one cause it was new and near by my office.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent choice, very nice and quiet hotel. You can enjoy a drink in a beautiful rooftop bar and shared a tasty cucine in main restaurant. Close to metro at Fulton StationAnd a lot of amenities: bar, shopping and cinema!! 100% recommended

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a relatively new hotel. Unfortunately, that's about all that we experienced that was good about it. Their air conditioning system didn't work. It was either too hot or too cold and we were unable to regulate the temperature. We mentioned this to the front desk staff and simply got an acknowledgement that yes, we indeed have problems and have also received complaints from other guests. If you chose to participate in their "green program" and elect not to have your room made up, you are supposed to receive a $5 coupon to be redeemed in their restaurant. Not only did we not get a coupon, but when we informed the front desk agent she said "oh really, well the restaurant is closed anyway so, sorry! No attempt to make amends. And when we elected to have our room made up on the 2nd night they didn't bother to vacuum. The sheets were to small for our king sized bed making for an uncomfortable sleep and the room was so small one could barely get around the bed! The most this room should have is a queen size bed. Our king devoured the room! Not a great experience! And not coming back!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Had two stays here, mostly for business in the district. Pleased with the standard of accomodation and the way the place was run. Rooms silent and well fitted out, and staff uniformly helpful and pleasant. Will return and can recommend.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I visit the Financial District often for work and this hotel makes the commute a breeze. The check in process is always painless and it's easy to store my luggage when I arrive early but don't want to cart my bag around to meetings. Free happy hour in the lobby is also a refreshing way to get settled in after a long work day.The rooms are always clean and comfy. The recent addition of room service at this hotel paired with reliable free wifi makes it easy to work from the peace and quiet of my room.Onsite dining includes a bar/restaurant that offers rooftop patio seating or street level patio seating in the warmer months. That's always a refreshing option after a long day in the office.Also recently used the fitness center for the first time and was surprised to find it was roomy and had plenty of new ellipticals and treadmills to choose from, as well as free weights and yoga mats.Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel for business travelers. I'll definitely be back soon!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Location good, bed & pillows high standard. Reception workers could be more service orinteted. Girls at breafast room, funny and well devoted, 10 points to them. Airconditioner difficult to use. Conference room poor standard,$ 500,00 for absolute nothing, coffe from paper cups, AV equipment really oldfashioned. Sorry to say but price vs quality does not match each others in this hotel. Room very dark, not lights enough.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed at this hotel starting on a Friday night through a weekend and had an excellent experience. Check-in was efficient, the room was a good size for NYC, very quiet, with a very comfortable bed, a nice HD TV, a large bathroom, and the wifi worked well. The room has various charging ports in the desk and by the bed, which is nice for us with a lot of gadgets. On the weekends, I did not leave the room until 1 or 2 in the afternoon so they could not clean the room, and the staff left a note they I could request any items and I need, and after I left they cleaned the room anyway; that's what I call service.The fitness center was one of the best I've used in an NYC hotel -- newer model ellipticals and treadmills, lots of free weights, exercise balls, floor mats, etc. I had a couple of guest passes to a full-on gym and didn't end up using it because this had all I needed.There is no breakfast, but there are a couple of restaurants attached, one of which does serve breakfast (Ketch). There's also a family-style Italian restaurant (Harry's) in the same building where I ordered a pizza one night and it was tasty. All-in-all a wonderful stay and would recommend to anyone. While the financial district is not the most "happening" part of the city. It's close to the WTC memorial, South Street Seaport, Battery Park and other things one might want to check out.
