Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel had a great location, was clean and well priced -- everything felt new.We booked an accessible room because I am in a wheelchair. When we arrived at 11PMthe bed was way too high. I literally could not get into my bed. It was ridiculous. No one with any disability could have climbed into this bed.LUCKILY, Alexander at the front desk came up and spent at least 20 minutes taking the bed apart to lower it so I could get it. Fantastic service from Alexander. But lower the bed!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We stayed here for two nights and on the first day explored (by foot) most of Lower Manhattan. An excellent location close to Battery Park, the 9/11 Memorial and Wall Street.A subway station is close by for those that wish to venture into other parts of the city (we walked to Central Park, stopping at various sites along the way).The rooms are smallish - we booked a deluxe room to get a little extra room as we had large suitcases. The room was clean, including the bathroom, and the linens crisp and fresh. Nice king-sized bed.The windows open slightly if you like fresh air. We had ours open all night and were not bothered by noise, however we were on the 26th floor so that may have made a difference. The air conditioning in the room was a little odd, it was set to 75 degrees and still blasted ice cold air at regular intervals. Some adjustments allowed us to just use the air from the open window to cool our room.Slightly odd setup with a "half" closet - if you hang your pants they fold up on the floor of the closet as below you'll find the room safe and a drawer. A little more lighting in the main room would have been nice.The Ketch Brewhouse is the restaurant associated with the hotel. We had dinner here one night - Caesar salad for starters, burgers for the main course, and a couple of beers each. Be aware prices are high in New York - it was around $90 for that meal, but it was good, with fabulous fries.Front desk staff were good - offering to store our luggage as we were too early for check in. They offered another room but we wanted to wait for the deluxe room as we knew it would be more roomy. Checked out at 3:45am as we had a very early flight - served promptly even at that hour.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is in a great position for tourists, as it very close to Wall Street, Battery Park, Brooklyn Bridge, 9/11 Memorial, Freedom Tower and to the Fulton subway stop, that takes you to many of the main attractions in NYC. Keep in mind however that there is no night life in the neighbourhood: you will need to go to somewhere else for that, like SoHo or Meatpacking (not that far though).The rooms are comfortable, clean and styled with modern furniture. What I really disliked was the staff's irritated and bored attitude: maybe it was just a bad day, but we arrived on a friday night, tired after a long day of work and travel, and were kept waiting for quite a long time at the front desk for no reason at all. Some people in our group had to deal with some issues concerning their credit cards, and not only the staff was not collaborative at all, but they also kept prioritising other guests (that arrived after us). Also, no one bothered to mention the initial deposit (that was charged without notice) nor when/how the full amount would have been charged on our credit cards. When I asked for the final check (at checkout) they did not seem very confident about it. In general, the staff seemed inefficient, unorganised and not interested at all.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We had a bad experience at Element Time Sq on our last trip so were apprehensive about NY hotels in this price category but this hotel was so much better than expected for the price that we will definitely stay here again next time we need to be in southern Manahattan. We needed a place for a Sat night before an 8am cruise from Pier 36 on a WW2 Liberty ship. We had driven a long way and arrived exhausted at 10:30. After dropping our cases in our room we were delighted to find the Ketch Brewhouse open with excellent service and drinks to relax before sleeping. The bar is so much better than typical hotel bars: it is worth staying here for that.The standard room are very small (2' space around a king size bed) and no unpaid upgrades were offered but it was clean and pleasant and the bed and bedding were very comfortable.The front desk got us a car to get to Pier 36 quickly and efficiently (ride cost $15 for 4 people). After dinner in the East Village a taxi back to the hotel cost $11 and the taxi driver knew where Platt St was and to get to the hotel without us saying anything (previous reviews had warned us this might not be the case).

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: You stupid people charged my card for $150.00 for what??? And now I have to fight the credit card company about my money for fraud. I called to the location today and now o have to fight with a SUPER IGNORANT that can't talk on the phone with me about t because she think she's super smart!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I spent 12 nights at this hotel. The room and bathroom were tiny - there was no space to unpack a suitcase, and the wardrobe could barely fit 3 sets of clothing! That said, if you are going away on a short trip, this place works fine. The bed was comfortable, the shower, adequate. Don't expect luxury- it's functional! Check in was quick and efficient, but there was noone to help with luggage. Check out was very efficient too.Housekeeping was a tad erratic. There's room for improvement.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was perfectly adequate albeit Manhattan tiny. The staff was super friendly and eager to help - even going so far as to restart the router on my floor to help improve the internet speed. The location is a little off the beaten track - even the taxis didn't know Platt St. All that said, it was a pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for work. It's located in the heart of downtown where you probably don't want to be as a tourist. A 5 minute walk from the metro though - so who cares... The rooms were really small, but otherwise totally fine. No complaints. I had dinner in the restaurant on the ground floor was pretty terrible, but the bar a floor up is pretty good. Oh - and the gym was OK as well. Would have given 3,5 stars if I could have done so.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We were in this hotel only for one night, but we had a very nice time then.Comfortable and clean room and in a good spot in the wall Street area.Michelyn was a very nice host during our stay. She helped us with every thing we needed. There is a nice resstaurant attached to the hotel.I reccomend it.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Just stayed for 2 nights and it was perfect. I was in a corner king room on the 26th floor, and it was not a connected room as a previous review stated.Well appointed with a nice large tv, modern amenities and nice and clean.Free coffee in the lobby in the morning.My only issue is that I couldn't connect to the wifi in my room although I had a full signal but it worked in the lobby.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The funniest exlusive rooms i ever had: The corner rooms can be opened together, but there will be a small gap remaining under, what helps you enjoy every noise from the neighboring two rooms...Tip refuse upgrade, but ask for higher level rooms, the panorama will be stunning!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We've just returned from a 4 night stay at the Four Points by Sheraton Downtown. Our room had all of the useful amenities we could have wanted- USB sockets by the bed, good little coffee machine, nice big TV, ironing board and iron. The bed was comfy and the room/ bathroom were clean. We were initially given a room on the 12th floor and were woken early on our first morning by some nearby construction noise. We asked to move room and the staff couldn't have been more helpful- thank you in particular to Michalyn. The staff at this hotel really do go the extra mile to keep the guests happy.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My first time staying in the Financial District, in many trips to NYC. It's an excellent location!! The hotel is an easy, interesting walk to Wall Street, South Street Seaport (bliss to sit on the pier on a hot day!) 9/11 Memorial, City Hall, Fulton Street subway, (with connections to everywhere, including train to JFK Airport) Staten Island Ferry, and some great, scenic MTA bus routes that will take you uptown, e.g. the M 3 bus.The hotel itself is fine and well-beyond adequate. I stayed in a corner room with queen sized bed, on 17th floor. The room was compact, but so well designed, I hardy thought of it as small. There are plenty of charging ports--on both sides of the bed. There is lighting on the headboard as well as on lamps and ceiling; a corner table (I used it for luggage) with almost hidden drawer in it; a desk; more seating should it be needed, tucked under the nightstands. Size-wise, only problem was the closet is too narrow for the hangers in it. The mgr said that was a problem in those corner rooms, so if you have large number of clothes to hang, ask for a room with a wide-enough closet.Coffee is available in lobby in the morning, or there is an in-room coffee maker. There are two free-use desktop computers in the lobbyAC was noisy as it cycled on--bring earplugs if you're a light sleeper.The outside phone line did not work the entire four days of my stay. This meant having to call the front desk from my mobile phone. Not a huge inconvenience, but hopefully an issue that is now resolved.There are nearby convenient places for food--e.g. Plaza Deli, Jubilee Market, if you don't want to eat out at restaurant. Attached to the hotel is a restaurant/brew pub, staffed with what may be the nicest greeting and wait crew in NYCStaff at the hotel are excellent. In particular, look for helpful, super friendly Alexander, and Michael, two of the nicest guys you'll ever meet in Manhattan! Lauren, the evening mgr, was helpful and eager to have the hotel experience be a good one. There is a very serious-demeanored security guard present as well.The only part of cleaning that could be improved is to have the hallway monitored better. Several times, there was paper trash on the carpet, and on the tables by the elevator--still there the next day. There room cleanliness was fine. Even the large windows-- facing the street from the 17th floor-- were spotless! I took the green" option on two of four days, to not have maid-service.Directions: DO have a map of some kind with you as you arrive for the first tie (Once at hotel, they will give you a one .) There are lots of small streets in the area, and even some cab drivers don't know the small Platt Street. It parallels John Street (this may help you at some point--trust me!) Also, if you take the subway to arrive, know that Fulton Street Subway station. has several entrances/exits, and I got myself quite "turned around" following google maps' directions. You'll see the tall Freedom Tower (check a photo if it is your first time to NY) from just about anywhere. Know that it is on the West side of Manhattan. This helped me sort out "uptown" (north) and "downtown" (South) when getting directions to the hotel. Though i sound like a confused newbie...I was born and raised in NYC! However, the Financial District was a whole new world!!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights with a mate. I have stayed in other areas of the city in the past, I'd say this would have to be a favourite!Subway stations within a few minutes walk, Wall Street very close by (also to a great little coffee shop), and the waterfront area is a nice place to see. The hotel it's self, very clean, staff very friendly, and with the type if room we had (traditional king) was perfect for exploring the city and coming back to refresh and have a good nights sleep! The room was comfortable, with a spacious bathroom so two of us could be getting ready for the day at once.One thing which would be great if there was a fridge in the room, however can't really complain as we did also receive complimentary waters each day being an SPG member.I do recommend staying here if you're not fussed about getting the subway, also if you don't want to be walking straight out of a hotel into the craze of the New York streets, the hotel is tucked away is some side streets which makes it even better!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I would have given the hotel 4 stars if there was a fridge in my room. Apart from that i think it is a very decent hotel. Good customer service, and nicely sized rooms. I am scoring them down on points because, its averaging 30+ degrees a day and im on holiday and expect to have cold water to drink. there are no fridges in the room and although there is an small ice bucket, its not the same as a fridge.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My sister and I spent 8 days, 7 nights at the Four Points NY Downtown. The staff customer service was excellent and accommodating. The single rooms are small but clean and we didn't spent much time in the hotel room anyway. WIFI was good and TV channels. The location is brilliant. Only 10/15 minutes from the 911 memorial and Wall Street, Brooklyn Bridge, etc. I would recommend getting a 7 or 21 day unlimited metro card. Once you get the hang of the subway, its fairly easy to navigate and cuts out all the traffic. We even took the subway back to the airport once it was time to leave. The people are helpful but there is a lot of homeless people begging in the street and on the trains but I suppose its to be expected in all the tourist areas. All in all it was a great experience. Before I went I was slightly wary of my safety but once there it was fine. Look after yourself just as you would if you were in your own country.Once again, thanks to Mich and all the staff at the Four Points.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This new hotel has a nice retro decoration. The room is quite spacious. The bed is very convenience in queen size. We had 2 beds. The bathroom is also spacious. However, the aircon is a little bit noisy. The service is just ok. I recommend you to stay at this hotel with a reasonable price.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Spent 5 nightsPositivesGreat locationfriendly staffwalking distance to subway, supermarkets, food stores Negatives area under construction, (temporary)No view, but not a problem for us.Outside hotel was a little grubby

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I called the hotel to reserve my 2 rooms Aug 4-7 with free brackfast, but the hotel refuses to provide the free breakfast, they told me, should have breakfast package. The hotel also advertises out-of-service over the roof bar. They should have updated their web site.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights with family, so 4 in a room with 2 double beds. The room was tight on space but was clean and the beds, although also small, were very comfy and the pillows were perfect and we all slept well. I was celebrating my 50th birthday and was surprised by a card and balloons from the staff - all of whom were super friendly and helpful throughout (especially Michalyn on the front desk). Thanks guys.Used on-site Ketch brew house for breakfast a couple of times, around $80-90 for 4. Smoked salmon omelette v good. There are quite a few other good (and cheaper) options within a 5 mins walk though. Location is good for Fidi, Downtown attractions and Subway for rest of NY area. Fulton St station was a minute's walk away (depending on line needed). Even used it to go back to JFK (elevator available on A platform for luggage).I'd happily stay again. Excellent value for NYC.Rating based on expectations (I was not expecting the Presidential Suite).

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: After a few trips to NYC, we've found that staying in the financial district is a nice area with many amenities without all the craziness and noise of midtown. The Sheraton brands are always our favs and this hotel is new. Not a lot of frills. Still feels new and is clean. The attached restaurant with 2nd floor patio bar is unique to this area. We found the prices very reasonable even for a last minute booking. Guest services were friendly and helpful with our requests.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Excellent location in the South part of Manhattan. Walking distance from the Brooklyn Bridge, Wall Street and World Trade Center, it´s perfect for whoever wants to visit that part of NY. The room was very clean, really nice, super comfortable bed.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This Hotel is a great place to stay if you are planning to stay in Downtown Manhattan!!This is 10-15 min walk from Brooklyn Bridge and Broadway & Wall Street and with Starbucks right next to the property this is a place for a coffee lover too!!With Free WiFi and great location, I will stay at the same location in my next visit too!!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This is a 3 star hotel masquerading as a 4 star. The rooms are small and the maid didn't change the bottom sheet during our four night stay. There are only 3 elevators for a 30 floor building. Nearest subway station is a long four blocks away.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Very convenient location to Seaport Area and my office (on Fulton Street). Rooms were small, bathroom was big and bright. Sheets were scratchy. I got a really bad rash from the bath products (I'm pretty sure that is what it was) and it took 4 calls to the hotel to find out what the bath products were (they were in dispensers in the shower, unlabeled). I would have loved to stay at this hotel again due to the location, but may think twice before I do.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Lady at the reception was highly unmotivated. When talking to the customers, she was speaking in a murmur, with zero eye contact. Curt replies with a sullen attitude. Because of this bad first impression, I even thought of paying the penalty and canceling my booking (because the last thing you would want in a vacation is to having to deal with this type of people). Good that I did not cancel, because I did not have any other issues during my stay. Perfect location, clean rooms.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We loved how close we were from all of New York Activities. We were able to walk eas ily to times square not far from many restaurants. Our room was small but we were only in our rooms to sleep. The front desk attendants were very helpful getting us a taxi. We would stay there again because of the location and hospitality.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel was mediocre at best in regards to the look... Very small. The rooms are small and sheets are scratchy. There was no mini fridge and the closet size was odd. The worst part of this hotel was the fact the air was broken. It took 4 calls to the front desk and 3 hours later for someone to come fix it and it only worked for 5 mins. By that time it was midnight and had to suffer with a 83 degree room.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: After a long day of traveling, I checked in to the Four Points In the financial district. The front desk attendant was very courteous and explained things clearly. I appreciated that you needed to scan your key card to access your floor. I had a king size bed and it was wonderful. The room was clean and the walk in shower was a great feature. I am not sure if housekeeping forgot to leave me hand soap, I just use the gel in the shower (a bit inconvenient). Toiletries are in bulk amount attached to the wall, very good from an environmental stand point. The free bottle of water was a very nice added touch. I would stay here again if I were touring lower Manhattan.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for a week and I enjoyed myself. The best part of this hotel is its proximity to the train station (Fulton Street), shopping and the waterfront. There are also several nice restaurants right across the street. I went to two Italian restaurants and had some very good meals. I enjoyed the formality at these restaurants which is rare on the West Coast. The hotel was nice, beautiful room but it was very small. The closets do not accommodate long clothing such as gowns or pants that are not folded. I traveled alone and felt safe walking around the area, even at night as there are police around walking the beat. The staff were young and friendly. Everything was clean. The things I did not like were the view as a I had a large building in front of my window, the back of it faced me and it was solid concrete, you had to peek to the side and crane your neck up real high and down to see anything else. The air conditioner was on and it was a little cold. There was no heat but as it was warm outside it did not matter. I left the air conditioner off and it was fine. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was very nice and the shower was easy to use. The room is cleaned daily and you are provided with fresh linens if that is what you want. If not you leave a card on you door to ask them to skip your room for the day. There is no refrigerator or microwave but then again I did not see food stains anywhere so maybe this is a good thing. They do provide ice free of charge and it will stay frozen for several hours is you use the ice bucket with the cover. The area is a little pricey but you can save money by buying your own water and snacks. There is a nice sized pharmacy within walking distance and many things to see and experience by subway and walking. I was able to figure out the subway on my first try. Get a subway map from the front desk and buy a week pass if you plan to say more than a few days. The ticket machines are at the subway and they are very easy to use. I also recommend getting the book NYC for dummies, it helped me tremendously. Overall a pleasant stay, I felt safe. The hotel was clean and comfortable. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Brand new hotel, in a great location. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. The manager of the hotel hosted a little gathering in the lobby with pizza and beer. She was warm and hospitable. The rooms are very well planned, and although NYC small, they have everything you need. The bar was fun, bartenders were professional and on it. Nice outdoor patio with tables at the entrance courtyard to sit with coffee or a quick lunch you can grab from many establishments within a quick walk. The South Street Seaport is also an easy walk and has nice shops and restaurants. Starwood is my favorite. All of my experiences with then at properties around the world have been wonderful

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Brought a friend who was visiting NYC for the first time for a 3-days trip. This hotel is very nicely located. About 12-15 mins walk to the 9-11 site, Chinatown, ferry for Statue of liberty. The hotel is new from this year, so it was very clean, although the room was a bit on the small side, but that was to be expected in NYC. A bit hard to find at first, even for the cab driver. Tea and coffee were a nice touch in the morning. However the free bottle of water was only available one night out of 3. The safe in our room did not work properly, even after they tried fixing it. The air cond was a bit loud in the room. The price is decent for such a nicely located hotel

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: While the hotel it self was fine the maintenance of it was not. On two days of four the room was not cleaned with out my request to have it done. On the first day they cleaned our room after I asked the housekeeper to do it. On the second day we returned to our room @ 4pm and it was not cleaned. The housekeeper knocked on our door @ 4:15p and I asked her to return to clean it an hour later and she did not. Upon departure that evening I asked the front desk to make sure that our was cleaned and it did not happen. When we called to complain the manager on duty told us that maybe the housekeeper did not understand English & our request! Btw, she spoke fluent English. This was not good customer service.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The Room is appropriate in size for New York Hotels, but is clean and well put together, all the basic amenities are there, except a weighing scale, which may be a useful addition for guests who may be taking a flight later like we were ! The check-in was fluent and non-cumbersome, they were extremely polite and helpful with the bags. The service was quick and responsive. Though our air-conditioning started making a huge sound on our second night and could not be helped by the technicians. But the hotel was prompt in sending the technician twice who earnestly tried his best. The next day, the management apologized for the disturbance and again was quite polite. The hotel is conveniently located close to the subway stations, theres enough to see around as well ! loads of nice food options around. The bathroom is clean, not outwardly luxurious but does the job absolutely fine. And We booked early and the hotel on advance purchase came to be quite a good deal ! Overall nice and pleasant stay !

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is brand new, the location is very good in the heart of the financial district, close to the 9/11 memorial, Battery park, Statue of Liberty ferry, Wall St. and Brooklyn Bridge, aswell as close to the popular discount store Century 21, all withing easy walking distance. The staff was very friendly and helpful, but we had some problems with the credit card at check-in, since they don't accept chip cards, in the end we had to pay cash. The room when we checked in was clean, a bit small as expected. We chose to "Make a green choice", which is supposed to mean that they don't change your sheets and towels every day, but in this hotel it apparently means they don't clean your room AT ALL.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: When I pulled up on the street - there is no place but the street to unload your bags - and no bellman there to help - I was skeptical. The room wasn't ready although it was nearly 1 PM and I had requested an early check-in. All that aside - the room was new, clean - and the beds were really, really comfy. It was quiet despite the construction next door and a completely full hotel. We slept well - no small feat for me especially in hotels - largely due to the super comfy bed, arctic a/c (we wondered why there were down comforters on the bed!) and very quiet. This location is about 4 blocks from the 911 museum, a short walk to Battery Park where you can board the Statue of Liberty tours, and Brooklyn Bridge. East walk to lower east or west, Soho, West Village, etc. It's a quiet hood at night as it's the Financial District which is great for sleeping - and there are plenty of inexpensive dining options within easy walking distance. No frills - but clean, comfortable room and great bed made for a terrific stay!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: First and foremost, I want to say how impressed with the service that we got from Elizabeth (Liz) and Michael at the front desk. Kudos!!!!!! These two were great and were willing to help us in anything we needed.Excellent place for downtown financial district. Within walking distance to 911 Memorial, charging Bull, Wall Street, The Battery, and ferry to Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty. Had four of us in a handicapped room. Not overly large, but from what I understand, meet New York's new standard size for room. The only negative was that we only had decaf coffee for our coffee maker in the room. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This was a nice hotel and one of the cheaper hotels in the area. It was near Financial district and Brooklyn bridge was within a mile. The room was small, with barely enough room for bed, but for 1 person it was fine. I think if 2 were to stay it might be a little crowded unless expecting only to sleep in room. My room was quiet at night, which I was worried about given the amount of construction nearby. No windows to the adjacent building to look in at me, so it was private and only 1 room beside mine (room 801). I would request this room if I could in future. I had a shower (no tub) in my bathroom, so the toiletry dispensers were fine. Hotel staff was very kind and helped me with my needs. Room was very clean. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This is the perfect hotel For Brooklyn Bridge and Financial District. The bridge and One World Observatory were walking distance from the hotel. Some of the taxi drivers were not familiar with Platt Street. I recommend just memorizing the address. My room was clean and quiet. I felt that the customer service was excellent. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The good: A good bed in a central part of NY for a decent rate. If you're just doing a quick overnight and need to be downtown for business this is ideal. If you just need a bed, this is your place. Close to transit and brand new. The bad:The rooms are small. It's NYC, so I'm not expecting much, but the bed is almost literally the entire room. Not ideal if it's more than one person. Even a couple would find it tight. If you've got kids, go elsewhere. The room has this noisy A/C unit. Like really, really noisy. It sounds like a 747 taking off and it seems to change its pitch every 30 seconds. I couldn't get a wink of sleep, which was really annoying. I won't return here just because of that. Bathroom was spotless but the room itself had stains on the sheets and someone had shoved a bunch of used tissue in the air vent. Kinda gross.As well, the staff are...less than welcoming to say the least. Shrugs and apathetic looks abound. I'm not expecting St. Regis service but at least acknowledging my SPG status and a simple smile would have been nice, but this is NY so that might be asking too much of these folks...Honestly, the price is decent but if you don't mind spending an extra $50 the W is right around the corner and looks a heck of a lot nicer.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Rooms were clean ,beds were very comfortable, front desk very helpful and courteous, black out curtains were very effective, I did not hear any noise from other rooms. Front desk had loan umbrellas and free coffee and tea,Negatives,Rooms are very small, hard for two people to maneuver around the room, no counterspace either in bedroom or bathroom, the dispensers for shampoo and soap were mounted too high for bathers. Coffee was removed early 10:30 not good for late risers.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Overal staff is very friendly and gives you a welcome feeling.Rooms are very well equipped and even tough space is not to big it feels very good.Bathroom has a nice big shower and everything is clean.Beds are very comfy and have tons of sheets and pillow you can choose from.The airco was pointed towards the bed and this is did not like due to reason you seriously can get a cold. So you need to boost to cold turn off and sleep. Also house keeping is very sloppy and even after asking reception did NOT refill my shampoo dispensers.A big turndown as you pay over 200 usd a night exclusive breakfast.Location is fantastic. Close to the subway and close to the waterfront. Financial district is much more quiet and for me was a nice way to spend time in a big city.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I staid one night in this Hotel. I came late and the check in was friendly and efficient.The location is great for a downtown business meeting , but the place is rather for hippsters than business people.Next door was a friendly bar, so overall it was OK.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Nice hotel. Location is on a narrow one way street. Parking is $40 / day in a parking garage close by. Hotel will validate it to reduce the price to $40!!!Close to battery park, wall street and other location. Small rooms, good customer service.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I stayed here for a business trip, so my main reasons for choosing this hotel were price and location. I requested a quiet room (as always) and received a quiet room. If security is a concern to anyone reading this, I had to use my room key to access my floor from the elevator.The location was very convenient. I was there for court, but there were lots of other things nearby. There was a bar/restaurant attached to the hotel, and the meal I had there was tasty. There was also a bar across the street, but I didn't go there (no noise or anything). Lots of other things to do within walking distance - shops, restaurants, Battery Park, WTC, Brooklyn Bridge. Close to the Fulton station - 2/3 train lines.Room itself was normal for NYC size standards. Clean and modern, if that's your style. Free wifi worked fine. My room had 2 free bottled waters, which I liked. Shower had dispensers rather than the little bottles, if you're into the green thing. Bed was super super comfortable, slept like a baby. The ice machine wasn't working, but the person working the check-in counter went next door to the aforementioned bar/restaurant and got me a bucket of ice, which was nice. (I stayed on April 12th and see a review on the 25th about the ice machine too. Hopefully they've fixed it by now!)Overall, pretty good stay. I didn't use gym or concierge services, so no comments on those. It'd be better if rooms had fridges (they weren't advertised, so I wasn't expecting them to be there or anything), but that's really my only negative. I'd probably stay here again though, since my main concerns for Manhattan are price, location, wifi, and a nice comfy bed.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: As an SPG gold member, I definitely expected more. I didn't get the perks I usually do. Besides the check in issues, the room was tiny and I wasn't upgraded as I usually am as an SPG Gold. Seriously, my college dorm room was larger. There was no fridge or microwave and the coffee maker was broken. The walls were paper thin and you could hear noises from other rooms. Theres a charge for self parking around the corner which was $35 with the hotel discount.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: It's hard to fault the location of this hotel being within walking distance to Battery Park (Statue of Liberty cruises), the World Trade Center area and the Brooklyn Bridge among many other shops and restaurants. Hotel is also in close proximity to the Fulton Street subway station that services quite a few lines. The lines with an exit closest to the hotel were the 2,3 lines. The room was new and comfortable, however, it is very small and has no fridge. The service we got was also quite poor as we had 4 guests in our double room but we consistently got 3 of each amenity and certain things were not replenished until we complained to reception.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is located in wall street. Fulton subway is few blocks away, just few steps of Century 21 department store. There are a lot of cafe and restaurants nearby. We had a bit of a snag when we checked in because my modified booking was not reflected in their system. But the friendly staff got it ironed out. We were able to go to our room earlier than their check in time. The staff are friendly and accommodating. Though the hotel is nice, but the room with the king size bed is very small. We are a couple and we had barely little space to maneuver. No space for our luggages. The bathroom is small. No ref. Good wifi connection. Overall... with the price of the room, it is quite reasonable.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Room was quiet comfortable, good bed .i would have expected a little fridge in the room at this price point. It was very hot outside, and would be great to find a cold beverage in the room. Because it is a Sheraton, I gave it 3 stars, in comparison to the other Sheraton hotels- otherwise it would be a 4 star

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Cookie cutter room with literally no room to move, having to dive in bed from the door. I understand New York size, but this hotel takes miniature at a new level. Obviously there is no bar or a small fridge and the dresser fits just couple of shirts at best. So for this one Four Points gets only 3 stars, and that just because the room was clean and the staff nice. Next time in the area I will go back to the Gild house.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I was very well welcomed by Lauren, who by the way was on shift when I checked out and managed everything very professional. Very pleasant staff. Hotel very well located in downtown New York, away from noisy Times Square and within walking distance from the subway, Battery Park and everything else in downtown. Has free wifi (nowadays it is what you expect). However there are some gaps for improvement. First, I requested a room with a city view (they are more expensive than standard rooms) and all I could see was 3 blocks of concrete and no city. This is not a city view. The hotel should specify this kind of rooms all it means is upper storey rooms, but nothing else (as one member of the staff told me). Second, the air conditioning is unbelievable noisy and not ideal to have that noise when asleep. Third, one day I returned to the hotel as late as 11pm to find that my room had not been serviced. I reported this to reception and the answer I got was that there wasn't any housekeeping at that time. This is not the kind of answer I expect from a hotel that charges 230 dollars per night and that does not include breakfast. It was not pleasant having to tidy the room myself, when all I wanted and needed was a shower and go to bed. Also, my bed wasn't nicely made every day; it looked somebody had rushed making it, putting the cover over the bed but the bottom sheet was not smooth and uncreased. Last, the last night I stayed was charged more expensive than the others, but when I booked the hotel, that was not specified. Overall, I don't recommend this hotel. Whereas the location is excellent (according to what I was looking for), there are other points to consider and I'm not impressed at all.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for business purposes. The Hotel is located in a surprisingly good area af the Financial District with a small square in front and a 2 minute walk away from Stone Street. Even though the Hotel room was small and it had no refrigerator, the bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean at all times. Staff was helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We enjoyed staying here during a recent conference at 60 Pine. A recent construction, it had all the amenities I would expect. The only downside was the packing was around the block (and a construction zone), rather than right across the street.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: If you're not waiting for the room service as told in the leaflet inside your room, you'll probably enjoy your stay in the Four Points, in financial district. The place is very convenient to reach the Brooklyn bridge or the pier to pick a tour to Liberty Belle.The bedding is comfortable enough, but something tight for two persons. I ordered a room with three beds and I got a double with two large bed. Large for one person but not for a couple.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Terrible hotel, very small rooms not as shown in the website. Electricity room is inside the hotel room. Staff has been dishonest to me, promised several times to change the room but did not. They have said hotel is very crowded while reservations are available online. I am very disappointed with this hotel as its one of sheraton hotels and this is my first time to stay in a sheraton hotel with this level of service and rooms.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: It is a nice hotel, in downtown Manhattan, cute rooms, clean, near Fulton station and with really funny and friendly staff.You are not very near to the main attractions of New York but it's all so easy with the subway.Downtown too is a really under-rated place to visit, full of "old New York" stuff.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel staff was amazing! The hotel it self just okay. The rooms were small, the water pressure non existent in the shower, my neighbors were loud, and the house keeping staff banged on my 4 times to get in to clean. While I appreciate them doing their jobs someone should have told them I had a late checkout. The neighborhood was interesting to navigate. I finally found all the restaurants the night before I checked out. Great if you are in town for fun, it is easy to get to other parts of the city. Not so much if you are here for business.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I had two rooms at this property for a week at the end of March/beginning of April. The staff are so accommodating and kind. The rooms were very nice. We had an issue the first with the a/c, but that was no problem because the staff were quick to resolve the issue. It was super close to a subway station and there were plenty of places to eat around the hotel.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is well located for the Staten Island ferry and Brooklyn Bridge and is within walking distance of The 9/11 Memorial. All the traditional sights are easily accessible by subway. There are plenty of bars, restaurants and grocery shops in the area. The place is a strangely soulless with none of the amenities of a larger hotel. Room 2007 was tiny and I heard other people comment on this aspect. I was on my own but a couple would have been really cramped in what was described as a double room. There is only one ice machine for the whole hotel located on the 2nd floor which was seldom working. I was on the 20th floor. The room had an iron but no ironing board. The staff promised to find one but I had to ask again before it arrived.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: If you're in town visiting, the location in Downtown/FiDi is great. Convenient to a few grocery stores, plenty of restaurants, all the sights in the downtown area and Fulton Station to get you to Brooklyn or Midtown/Uptown. Same goes for business; if you're working at an office here in FiDi, great location. Hotel is clean, staff friendly and welcoming. Wifi works well Ice machine is broken and with fridge, only leaves a trip to the bar for some ice.However, for the price category the room leaves quite a few things to desire. No place to hang anything (again - for business that's bad!). Got an iron but no board and also not really a surface to use. Desk is tiny you can barely sit down and the closet doesn't again anything to hang something up. So what is it for anyway? Even if you had a hanger and a hook, still wouldn't find a jacket or shirt though unfortunately. Also bathroom while decent size for the location, has more a dorm room feel.Given the price, I feel overcharged.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Spent a Saturday night here this weekend. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and a great value. The location is great especially if you want to avoid the crowds of midtown. Plenty to do around the hotel and just over the Brooklyn bridge in DUMBO.Easy access to the 2/3 subway lines and the East River water taxi.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Staff are very friendly, maybe someone to help with bags though? Rooms are nicely set-up and very clean. Only two issues are low pressure in the shower, not awful, but not great. No fridge in the room, would be good for cold drinks and snacks...would also earn them more money. A welcome pack and local guide book would also be good.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The rooms were very clean and comfortable.This hotel is located right in the financial district.. It is very close to the subway station. So, very convenient to go around NYC.Check-in, check-out process was smooth.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Stayed here in April, and from the moment I walked in the hotel to checking out, my experience was a 5 Star stay! The staff at the front desk made my stay so wonderful,with their willingness to be flexible, and their recommendations for local restaurants, etc. The rooms are amazingly comfortable and the hotel itself still have that "Brand New Hotel" Smell about it. I would by all means stay at this property again upon returning to NYC.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Positive: great location, walking distance to World Trade Center, Brooklyn Bridge, Battery Park, plus much more. Clean, modern rooms (very small, but that's not unusual for this area). Bed very comfortable, towels soft and fluffy. Windows open for fresh air. The staff was all very friendly and nice. Free bottled water and free WiFi. Good reading lights around the bed. Good TV. Our room was quiet.Negative: Heating/AC just seemed like blasting air, no matter the setting. Bathroom could use better lighting for the ladies, and a make-up mirror. Left in the AM and came back at 3:30 PM and room had not been cleaned. Despite being nice the staff were not particularly well informed. They need a concierge who really knows the city. They sent us to a restaurant that was closed for renovations and almost directed us to the wrong train. Don't bother going to the attached restaurant.I'd like to give it a 3.5 rating because average seems not good enough, but very good seems too much.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I travel a lot but rarely do I find a brand new hotel, where you don't have to worry about dirty furnitures, leaky sinks, etc. I travelled with my daughter this time and what a find when we booked with this hotel! Everything was clean, comfortable beds, pillows, and the customer service at the front desk was awesome! Thank you Lauren for checking us in quickly and giving us a wonderful room with two beds, and thanks to Michalyn for answering our questions when we checked out. Wish I got the names of everybody at the front desk but you all are a great team, making your guests feel welcome and always willing to help. Hotel is also in a prime location where you can just walk anywhere around the Financial District. I think I found my go-to hotel whenever I'm in NY! Thanks Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown!!!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The room was beautiful but kind of small, but everything was modernized and updated. They upgraded our rooms for no cost and also a later check out time as well. Alexander was wonderful and met all of our requests, he even warmed our food because there wasn't a microwave and bought it to our room. It was a great distance to everything and he Fulton street train station is a 6 minute walk. Recommend taking the subway than Uber/Taxi because it is more affordable. They have soap/shampoo dispensaries. Complimentary water each day. And you have to use your key card to get up and down the elevator, so that made it safe. Also 9/11 Memorium and Brooklyn Bridge was very close. GREAT STAY! Will definitely stay on next trip.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: I love everything about this hotel: clean, nice bed, wonderful service, awesome staff, great location (3' walk to Fulton station, where you can catch train to everywhere). I also like thier restaurant, the food is great. One thing that bother me is parking. We called in advance and the staff said its $30/day, and it turned out $40/day because we have a small suv. And they over charged us (only $9 but i just dont like to be charged for no reason). One other thing is that we had to park our car entire time there, no in or out during the day. I dont know if its normal in NYC but I wish the staff told us before hand so we can plan better.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This was one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had. We paid $166 per night for a 3 night stay, and the accommodations were excellent in a safe area. That is an unbelievable deal in NYC. The hotel is brand new, so everything is clean and bright. The beds were wonderful. Small room, but normal for NYC. The staff was top notch. We were celebrating my mothers 50th birthday, so we were given vouchers for a round of drinks for our party by Kathy at the front desk. One of us was ill on the last day, so they allowed us a late checkout of 2 PM so that we could rest. Several good restaurants within walking distance and a few minute walk to the subway. All in all, an excellent value and great accommodations! Highly recommend. We will be back!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: The hotel is very conveniently located, close to Wall St., Little Italy, Battery Park, Chinatown, and the WTC. Hotel staff were excellent - in particular Michael Bryan and Michalyn at the front desk. These employees should be recognized for their outstanding service. I would recommend this hotel.However, the food and service at the adjacent restaurant need to be greatly improved.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: This hotel is a great surprise for a four points! The staff is excellent and particularly for New York standards exceptional! The are friendly and very much devoted to help you. Additionally the corner room we had was of good size what is rare in NYC. Since the hotel is very new everything is of good standard and well maintained.This hotel sets new Standards for Four Points"

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Was in town to attend a seminar and found the Four Points Sheraton close to where I needed to be and reasonably priced. I found out the hotel has only been opened for a few months, which makes sense since the Taxi driver had no idea where this hotel was, so I had to GPS him in. The hotel is tucked away in a corner surrounded of course by taller buildings. Was clean and open in the lobby area. I was checked in by Lauren who genuinely seemed to like her job and was super friendly. I asked about directions getting around on the subway, which was only a couple blocks away, and she knew exactly which train I needed to take to get me where I wanted to go. There were two other ladies at the desk that day, whose names I didn't get (sorry), but they too were friendly and greeted me with smiles. I reserved a room with a king bed, and it took up most of the room! No worries, I have stayed in NY before and most rooms are very small, but I just needed a bed and shower for the night so it was fine. Room was clean and comfortable, nice flat screen TV, Wi-Fi worked and was quick, bathroom new and modern. I liked the fact they had dispensers in the shower for Shampoo, Conditioner, Shower Gel, instead of those stupid bottles, that don't always get used, unless I take the remainder. The dispensers just seemed a little less wasteful and environmentally sound. The hotel was only about a block or so away from Wall Street and a few blocks from One World Tower/Ground Zero. Multiple restaurants and pubs around, so no need to go far, unless you want to go uptown, then just jump on the Fulton Street subway. Overall my stay at this Sheraton was really nice and all of the staff were great from check in to check out. I would highly recommend if you need a good priced hotel in the Financial District!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here for valentines day weekend, we really liked the staff, Mechilyn(I forgot how to spell her name)checked us in. She's really great. We booked with free breakfast and city view. The elevators to the rooms were broken, only one was working so staff and visitors had to cram in one. Our FIRST room was 2603, first impression of the room, it was small(expected in NYC)but very pretty. I absolutely loved the bathroom, the big flat screen tv and the pillows. The smell of the entire hotel and room was wonderful! The city view was only looking into the windows of apartment buildings next door. It didn't bother us though. We went out and came back about 11pm and only one elevator still working. Our key wouldn't let us up. Had to wait on staff to let us up. I got ready for my shower just to realize there's no knob to turn shower on!! I literally washed up at the sink! The next morning they didn't have another room for us yet so they gave us a key to another room to only take a shower in! It was so awkward, we showered in a freezing cold room that wouldn't heat up and then went back up to our room, by riding elevator to 25 and walking up to 26 because our key still wouldn't work in elevator. We were leaving for the day, staff told us they will have a bigger better room for us when we got back, and they would move our things to the new room. Breakfast wasn't great just average. Its not buffet style, its menu order. When we got back to hotel, we got our new room key, new room 1004. We loved this room, it was big and had a working shower. Sleeping was very uncomfortable because when you turn on heat, it blows directly onto the bed. We were sweating no matter how low we turned down heat. We kept getting up all night turning it off and on cuz when u turn it off the room got freezing cold really quick. Very uncomfortable stay, a huge inconvenience. I was not happy with our stay at all. And now I am sick with stuffy nose and sore throat from that stupid heat blowing on my face every night. But the staff, everyone was wonderful. And the waitress who served our breakfast with the black and greenish hair was such a sweetie also! No hard feelings but we will probably not come back here.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: We were there for the Asian New Year. We stayed at four points and our receptionist Ruth was so nice and helpful. We had a few laughs. We love our room and the price is reasonable. Time square was a few blocks away and the subway to China town is right around the corner. We would take the Subway, now that we know how to use it. Thanks Ruth for making our stay enjoyable.

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton New York Downtown
review_body: Saturday 2/6-2/7, 2016. New! Extremely clean and comfortable. Well designed rooms. The neighborhood offers a wealth of excellent restaurants. One thing however-- The hotel restaurant needs to better communicate with front desk: it took several attempts to redeem pre-paid breakfast coupon, and restaurant tried to charge $6.00 for coffee included with American Breakfast per the menu description. Restaurant management was disappointing and doesn't reflect outstanding hotel management and service. Highly recommend this hotel.
